Title: Moo Money
Desc:
Josiah Bigras, Almaza Karam, Nathan Lee, Autumn Shaw
https://github.com/GreyLake/GNG4120-G3 

Moo Money is an innovative online financial education company focused on providing high-quality video lessons. By leveraging modern internet technology and industry insights, Moo Money aims to provide children and young adults with streamlined and accessible financial education to support their personal growth. Moo Money's core business concept revolves around offering tailored financial and educational products and services designed for anyone and recognizing that the modern education system severely underpins young people when it comes to financial knowledge; Moo Money provides a convenient and easy-to-use solution to this common problem. Moo Money is accessed online through a website or application and provides a diverse catalogue of financial and educational media. Included in Moo Money‚Äôs catalogue are lectures on financial topics, interactive education games/quizzes, real-time financial advice, and more.

Title: Accessible Bluetooth Joystick
Desc:
Many Kids with disabilities affecting hand and arm movement find traditional computer mice difficult to use. The Point It! Joystick mouse, a rare Bluetooth joystick option, faces charging issues that the developer isn't addressing. Other joysticks lack Bluetooth connectivity, which is crucial for versatility across devices and platforms, or are not compact, making wheelchair mounting difficult.
Our task is to design a compact, Bluetooth-enabled joystick mouse, similar in size (12x12cm) and functionality to the Point It!, with reliable and easy recharging. It must be user-friendly for non-technical users, rugged, easy to clean.

Title: GNG2101-Z2.2-CardMountDevice
Desc:
Problem 
Design a device that can mount to an arm rest or wheelchair tray and can hold playing cards in place. It needs to be easily adjustable when reaching for cards and not block the communication board on the wheelchair tray. It needs to have an interchangeable interface for the user to hold up physical cards or a tablet.

Solution
We adapted a monitor arm using custom 3D printed mounts. These mounts are attached to the arm using the VESA screw patterns meant for computer screens. An acrylic sheet is attached to the 3D printed mount and can hold cards or a tablet. The monitor arm can swivel on 3-axis, support 30lbs and can go up and down. It is attached to the tray using a c-clamp. The aesthetics of the solution were customized based on the client's requests.

Cost
  • 35$ for a monitor arm
  • 15$ for 450g of PLA
  • 15$ for an acrylic sheet
  • 10$ for miscellaneous hardware
  • 5$* for stickers (not needed but client requested)
Total= 75$ (or 80$ with custom aesthetics)

Important Details / Struggles
  1. Have access to FDM 3D printer
  2. Include internal ribs in 3D parts to increase stiffness
  3. Ensure parts have rounded corners to decrease print time from toolhead making sharp turns
  4. Limit the use of overhangs so the quality of the print is better and the time to print is shorter (no supports needed)
  5. Print knobs using material that doesn't crack when press fitting nuts, such as ASA or ABS
  6. Bending the acrylic sheet is very difficult and requires access to a heat gun
  7. The force of the springs in the monitor mount is meant for screens, so it is very strong when the weight of the attachment is low

Title: EquiBike (Inclusive Bike - Winter 2024)
Desc:
The Equibike is a product designed to provide an affordable solution for wheelchair users to enjoy cycling on a standard bike. The Equibike was conceived with two primary objectives: (1) to be cost-effective compared to existing alternatives, and (2) to be universally compatible with most standard bikes. 

The design of the Equibike also takes into account environmental considerations, with components sourced from repurposed materials. The Equibike comprises two main systems: 

  1. Mechanical System: This includes the ramp, floor, frame, attachment mechanism, and wheels. 

  2. Electrical System: This is divided into two major subsystems - a communication system for the cyclist and wheelchair user, and a signal and brake light system. 

Overall, the Equibike aims to make bike rides an inclusive and enjoyable experience for wheelchair users.

Title: Souris r√©ductrice de tremblements
Desc:
• Contexte:
 Dans le cadre du cours GNG2501, notre objectif pour ce semestre est de concevoir une souris d‚Äôordinateur √† mobilit√© contr√¥l√©e pour les individus souffrant de tremblements, afin de faciliter l'ex√©cution de t√¢ches pr√©cises √† l‚Äô√©cran. Le circuit de contr√¥le, bas√© sur Arduino, comporte des boutons associ√©s √† des niveaux de force d√©finis par un code sp√©cifique, emp√™chant l'activation de la souris si la force appliqu√©e ne correspond pas au niveau s√©lectionn√©.

Title: Switcheroos: Magnose
Desc:
The Nintendo Switch joy-con controllers are not accessible to those with unique abilities, particularly users that can only interact with devices using their nose.

Prior designs have attempted external accessories that would adapt to the buttons on the controllers. However, the mechanical nature of these external adapters have created unnecessary force that made them difficult to use with the nose.

Therefore, this project strives to leverage the mechanics of the joy-con that already work for users by replacing the buttons with form factors that meet our client's needs.

The flat buttons, (plus, minus, home, screen capture), are not accessible. We have designed replacement buttons that are elevated to the same height as buttons that are already accessible so that there is parity in the user experience.

The back trigger buttons (L,R, ZL, ZR) are not reachable by our client. We have reverse-engineered these trigger buttons and have embedded magnets into them that make a bespoke lever component easier to interact with someone's nose. We use external magnets to allow the user to position these arms so that the ZL/ZR triggers can be held, which is helpful for accessing menus in our client's favourite games.

Title: GNG1503-F03-My Booking Space
Desc:
Le gouvernement du Canada se trouve confront√© √† des d√©fis en mati√®re de r√©servation des salles et bureaux pour leurs espaces de travail. Les employ√©s rencontrent des difficult√©s √† apporter leurs effets personnels ou √† choisir un emplacement satisfaisant sans subir d'inconv√©nients qui entravent leur productivit√© pendant les heures de travail, en raison de la performance insatisfaisante du site de r√©servation actuel.

Notre vision est de minimiser ces inconv√©nients en cr√©ant un site web permettant aux employ√©s de choisir leurs emplacements, favorisant ainsi l'augmentation de la productivit√© et la cr√©ation d'un environnement de travail agr√©able pour tous.

Le co√ªt de notre projet s'√©l√®ve √† 45 $, car le site web a √©t√© cr√©√© par notre √©quipe √† l'aide d'un logiciel gratuit, mais offre des options payantes incluant davantage d'outils pour enrichir le site.

Cependant, il est important de noter que la cr√©ation d'un syst√®me similaire peut poser des d√©fis d'interface, car il n√©cessite une refonte compl√®te du site web pour r√©pondre aux besoins sp√©cifiques de chaque organisation. Cela demande une analyse approfondie pour garantir la cr√©ation d'une alternative adapt√©e et efficace.

Title: GNG2501-TableAjustable-C3.2
Desc:
Pour manger et boire ce client grimpe ses avant-bras sur le bord d'une table avec ses doigts et utilise le mouvement de ses poignets pour bouger ses mains.

Lorsqu'il n'est pas a la maison il n'a aucune fa√ßon de manger sans aide. Il aurait besoin d'une table qui peut √™tre install√© sur sa chaise o√π il peut grimper ses mains ensuite lever la table pour manger √† une hauteur confortable. D'autres tables ont √©t√© essay√©s auparavant par contre elles √©taient trop lourdes et difficile √† installer.

Votre t√¢che est de concevoir une table ajustable qui repose sur les jambes et peut monter environ 6 pouces. Elle doit √™tre facile √† installer et robuste pour tenir une assiette et une tasse. Elle doit aussi √™tre facile a nettoyer et confortable pour l'utilisateur. La table doit √™tre √©lectrique et activ√©e avec un bouton sur la table. Elle ne doit pas bloquer acc√®s aux accoudoirs de la chaise et id√©alement pourrait se replier pour mettre dans un sac pour la transporter.

Title: EROSION ACCELERATORS
Desc:
Welcome to Erosion Accelerators, where we're not just a group of scientists; we're a team of erosion detectives! üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Picture us as the Sherlock Holmes of erosion, diving deep into the mysteries of how our world changes over time.


Our project, the Cylinder Test, is like our magnifying glass, helping us zoom in on the tiniest details of erosion. Imagine a core sample as our trusty sidekick, whispering tales of its adventures in the natural world. From wind-blown deserts to rain-soaked mountainsides, each sample carries a story etched into its surface.


But we're not just here to listen; we're here to decode. With each measurement, we uncover clues that piece together the puzzle of erosion. It's not just about numbers and data; it's about understanding the heartbeat of our planet and how it evolves over time.


So, join us on this adventure as we don our detective hats and embark on a journey through the intricate world of erosion. Together, we'll unravel its secrets, one core sample at a time. Welcome to Erosion Accelerators, where science meets storytelling, and curiosity is our compass! üåçüîç

Title: GNG1103_Jigsters
Desc:
1. A need exists for door manufacturers to quickly and easily install a flush bolt into a wood-plated steel door with a reusable, dust-resistant device, adjustable, and cost-effective device for owners.
2. An adjustable door jig was produced with interchangeable plates which can be mass-produced and resized as needed, to fit all door widths. The jig is used to assist with installing a flush bolt into metal double doors.
3. Approximately 50$ +HST (spent $41)
4. When mass-producing the plates, they can have imperfections that could misalign the jig.

Title: GNG1103-TripleThread
Desc:
The jig is used to route flush bolts on doors during the manufacturing process by AMBICO. The objective of our project is to make a durable, reusable, and economical jig that is user-friendly, accurate, and effective. Our solution was to create a jig that wraps around the door and uses a screwed clamping system to stay on the door during the flush bolt prep process. The jig accommodates different door thicknesses by having multiple slots for adjusting the backset. Some key details to keep in mind are the 86.4-degree bevel needed on the design to match the bevel on AMBICO's doors, in addition to making sure the clamping system doesn't damage the veneer on the door. A budget of $50 was allocated for the prototypes, and the current cost of all the prototypes stands at $24.49.

Links:
OnShape:
https://cad.onshape.com/documents/2b18156738e0c28808f0d5b6/w/24aeec69af80e84b61bf7f91/e/c6308dead22814a6a53a9d0b renderMode=0&uiState=65fb345250ee6d1f2800af33

Title: GNG1103-G03-Flush bolt jig - Jig jackpot
Desc:
A need exists for Ambico's machinists to precisely route a flush bolt cutout in a door with an adjustable jig that is easy to use, does not damage the door, and reduces time in the cutout process. Our solution: an adjustable steel jig which centres itself precisely via a backset guide that can be adjusted for 1 3/4" to 2 3/4 " in 1/4" increments. To get there, our team used the 5 step iterative design process and came up with a low costing, durable jig. When Ambico creates this jig, it will cost less than 50 dollars and uses recycled materials they have around their warehouse. The manufacturing process of this jig also incorporates machines that are already in Ambico's possession, to create an easy assembly process. 

A CAD model of our final design:
https://cad.onshape.com/documents/a76f5b889e0d6041acb883e7/w/c93b74e8f0524e07d4091cb1/e/161347f3fc97a219f6292d16?renderMode=0&uiState=6601b1de778a5d41f4ff24de

https://cad.onshape.com/documents/323f9da910c97101955ae9ef/w/8c213120d53fd4978d23e165

Title: Jigs & Rigs Solutions
Desc:
Our team has collaborated to conceive a prototype jig to help our clients at Ambico with a highly tool-specific task. The clients needs included a jig that allows for easy installation of their flush bolts. We have come up with a solution that addresses all client needs and specifications while keeping the budget light. Their needs included a jig that was simple to use, precise, and was accurate in the centering of the flush bolt cut out. Our given budget was $50, and was one of our biggest constraints in meeting our clients needs. 


Prototype 3:

Title: Ban the Bot's
Desc:
Problem Statement:

The purpose of this project is to demonstrate the harmful impacts autonomous weaponry has when implemented present in society. 

Our Project Description:

Virtual reality walkthrough begins in the first scene where it displays subtle beginning to our overall story line. The VR walkthrough will begin at the edge of the bed in scene 1 the VR player will be able to functionally interact with the TV remote. The player needs to locate the TV remote which we have highlighted indicating its importance to the progression of the story. The Tv will turn on once the remote has reached the players hand and will display a news cast.  Once the Tv has been turned on the full screen will navigate to the television where an audio broadcast will be displayed indicating the progression and impact autonomous weaponry has had on this community.  


The transition between scenes 1 and 2 will happen as the news cast goes from the audio recording to the scene of the conflict created by autonomous weaponry. The beginning of scene two starts in this ally way spoken about in the broadcast that seems to have been damaged due to last night events. The user will begin to walk through this damaged area witnessing all the objects, buildings and efforts put in to create this new society. The disaster from the night before will demonstrate the impact autonomous weaponry has had on this society. The character will walk through the full scene and eventually the scene will occur black turning into our third transition.

Title: Accelerated erosion Testing
Desc: Erosion testing is a crucial process for assessing how materials withstand abrasive forces, but it often takes too long to yield meaningful results. This project revolves around creating a prototype erosion testing system that can significantly speed up this process. The aim is to provide manufacturers with a faster and more cost-effective way to evaluate material erosion, without compromising on safety or data reliability. By addressing these needs, we hope to empower manufacturers to make quicker and more informed decisions about material selection, ultimately enhancing their operational efficiency

Title: GNG1103-F2-BreakingGood
Desc:
Problem Statement: The client needs a safe, cost-effective, and durable testing device to measure the environmental parameters and increase the effect of erosion on the material accurately and consistently, all the while capable of showing results within a month.

Our Solution: We designed an erosion-testing device that vertically holds the sample on a rod and spins a slurry around it to cause erosion. 

Cost: Approximately $96

Details:
- Ensure the motor that spins the system does not overheat
- The rod that holds the sample must securely fit the cavity in the lid where the motor is placed
- Make sure that the sample can be held tightly in its allocated space throughout the erosion testing process
tags: ['Course-related Projects / Projets reli√©s a des cours', 'GNG1103/GNG1503', "uOttawa Team Projects / Projets d'√©quipes uOttawa", '3D Printer', 'Arduino Microcontroller', 'Laser Cutter', 'Lathe']

Title: Dream Team Accelerated Erosion Test System
Desc:
The client needs a safe, durable, and cheap testing device to increase the effect of erosion on the sample in an accurate and consistent manner to measure the environment parameters within a time frame of under a month. 

The solution that was chosen was to take a container and fill it with a slurry mixture. There would be a thermometer and a scale to keep track of the temperature and weight. The sample would be shaped like a propeller and would be attached to a rod that is attached to a motor at the top of the container. The motor will be a stepper motor connected to a breadboard which is connected to an arduino. 

The total cost is estimated to be $103 after tax and shipping

Making the arduino motor work was the biggest roadblock that the group encountered. Not having a schematic to base off what was being made, and no prior experience, as well as not knowing if all the parts worked, the original plan for the motor had to be changed.

Title: F10-DesignDynasty-AcceleratedErosion
Desc:
TurboRosion- The Ultimate Accelerated Erosion Testing Device. 
Works by spinning any chosen sample in water (+ abrasives) to erode it and report the rates of Erosion to the user. It features a display, RPM control, Emergency power switch, and more.

Title: GNG2101-E1.2 - EZ-WNDW
Desc:
Designing a device capable of remotely opening and closing a sliding window for individuals with reduced mobility. 

Our solution consists of a mechanical aspect (for operating the window accordingly), an electrical aspect (power supply and electronics) and a software aspect (an app to be used by the client from her phone or ipad to remotely control the device).

On the mechanical side, our solution consists of a lead screw driven linear actuator mechanism to open/close the window, a mounting base to hold the mechanism and a latch-based window-to-device connection system (to allow for switching to manual operation of the window).

The electrical side comprises a DC power connector for direct current supply, a fuse holder for safe integration of fuses, a stepper motor with its integrated circuit for precise movement, a voltage regulator for stable output, and additional components such as a WiFi-enabled ESP32 microcontroller, humidity sensor, and LEDs. Designed to ensure a robust power supply and proper device operation, it includes features like overcurrent protection and controlled movement within the circuit. 

On the software side, we used the ESPHome Framework to integrate with the Home Assistant Companion app for a trusted and accessible software solution for smart home devices. This allowed us to develop an easy-to-use application that can interface with our device remotely (as we are using an ESP32 microcontroller), and that includes Siri voice control integration to allow for a more accessible solution for our client. 

Our design cost an approximated total of $95 (CAD), which fell under our allotted budget of $100 for this project,

Some important details to consider when replicating this design include the sliding window type, it's dimensions and the specific client's use cases (e.g., whether or not they require a manual mode of operation for caregivers to operate the window, whether or not they require to remove the window frame to clean it for example, which would require the device to be removable or moved out of the way). These various requirements greatly affected the design of the solution to cater for the client's needs as much as possible while ensuring a functional solution.

Title: GNG1503 FE34 MYNK'S
Desc:
La famille Weston, propri√©taire d'une exploitation agricole sp√©cialis√©e dans la culture de fraises, est confront√©e √† un d√©fi majeur : assurer une production efficace et durable de fraises tout au long de l'ann√©e. Actuellement, la d√©pendance aux conditions climatiques saisonni√®res et la n√©cessit√© d'une pollinisation manuelle entravent la rentabilit√© et la continuit√© de la production.
L'objectif est de concevoir un produit automatis√© et ouvert au march√© qui permettra √† la famille Weston, ainsi qu'√† d'autres cultivateurs, de produire des fraises de mani√®re efficace et soutenable tout au long de l'ann√©e. Ce produit devra r√©soudre les probl√®mes li√©s √† la pollinisation, √† la d√©pendance aux saisons et offrir une solution rentable et accessible pour les producteurs de fraises. La r√©ussite de ce projet contribuera √† garantir une offre constante de fraises fra√Æches sur le march√©, tout en am√©liorant la durabilit√© environnementale de la production agricole.
Nous avons donc con√ßu une tige avec une pointe √† laquelle nous avons int√©gr√© un moteur vibrant en vue de faire vibrer les plantes pour favoriser la pollinisation naturelles des fraises.

Title: GNG2501- √âquipe Polaris (C1.2)
Desc:
One of the major challenges faced by many individuals is the effective management of ambient light and its impact on their vision. For our client in particular, this issue is of capital importance, considerably affecting her daily visual comfort. Indeed, exposure to different levels of light, whether natural or artificial, represents a major challenge for our client's vision, who currently has to juggle between 2 to 3 pairs of sunglasses to cope. 

Our mission is to design a unique pair of dynamic polarization glasses whose lens tint is capable of adapting to light variations, with a budget of 100$.
-------------------------------

L‚Äôun des d√©fis majeurs rencontr√©s par de nombreux individus est la gestion efficace de la luminosit√© ambiante et son impact sur leur vision. Pour notre cliente en particulier, cette probl√©matique rev√™t une importance capitale, affectant consid√©rablement son confort visuel au quotidien. En effet, l'exposition √† diff√©rents niveaux de luminosit√©, qu'ils soient naturels ou artificiels, repr√©sente un d√©fi majeur pour la vision de notre cliente, qui doit actuellement jongler entre 2 √† 3 paires de lunettes de soleil pour y faire face.

Notre mission est de concevoir une unique paire de lunettes √† polarisation dynamique dont la teinte des verres est capable de s'adapter aux variations de lumi√®res, avec un budget de 100$.

Title: GNG5140-Bio-composite Spoke Protector (Modular Ultralight eV Prototyping)
Desc:
Every year, millions of plastic spoke protectors end up in landfills and waterways, harming wildlife and polluting our planet. Traditional materials simply aren't sustainable, and cyclists deserve a better choice. 
 
  Introducing the future of spoke protection! Introducing our revolutionary biocomposite spoke protector, crafted from natural flax fibers and eco-friendly resin. It's lightweight, durable, and built to last, protecting your spokes while respecting the environment. 
  
 Our bio composite protector is not just eco-friendly, it is superior. It boasts superior strength and flexibility, offering unmatched protection for your spokes and gears. Plus, unlike plastic, it biodegrades at the end of its life, leaving no harmful trace behind.
  
  So what? Imagine a world where every cyclist chooses a sustainable option, reducing our environmental footprint and safeguarding our planet for future generations. Who cares? Every cyclist, every outdoor enthusiast, every nature lover. Why us? Because we believe in pushing the boundaries, because we're passionate about cycling and the planet, and because we believe you deserve a better choice.

Title: CITY POLLUTION MONITORING - GNG 5140 F2023
Desc:
Air pollution in cities is a rising concern, and it is well known that fossil fuels consumed by vehicles are a major contributor. Our project is a pollution monitoring device that functions primarily to collect data about transportation-related pollution levels in the city throughout the day. The device will focus on collecting data on levels of particulate matter and carbon dioxide. We also aim to study the influence of electric vehicles and localized human activity on pollution levels. The device is based on an existing prototype, which is a module mounted on an e-bike. We aim to scale down and simplify the module to make it more human portable and user friendly, while simultaneously streamlining the collection and visualization of data.

Contributing members:

Adrian Iannantuono, 300071774
Drishya Suresh, 300322663

Myron Soares, 300346181
Tarin Sultana, 300393224

Title: GNG2101-B5.4-Painting Assist Tool
Desc:
While the world of acrylic painting offers a creative outlet and a source of joy for many, there are significant barriers for individuals with limited arm or hand functionality. Existing tools and techniques often fall short in providing an inclusive and accessible experience, limiting the artistic expression of those with disabilities. Furthermore, introducing newcomers, especially children and adults, to acrylic painting can be intimidating due to the complexity and messiness associated with traditional methods. These challenges hinder both groups from fully embracing and enjoying acrylic painting. 

Our objective is to address these issues by offering a specialized painting assist tool that caters to the unique needs of individuals with disabilities and provides an easy and cleaner entry point for beginners. By doing so, we aim to make acrylic painting an enjoyable and inclusive activity for a broader audience. 

Cost:  169.85 

Struggles/Important Details
  • The maximum canvas size was shortened from our initial size due to our budget not being big enough
  • We were not able to keep the prototype under budget
  • Additional features such as rotation of the canvas were planned ot also be added but were later removed

Title: GNG2101-TalkBox

Title: Painting Assist
Desc:
This client is an acrylic fluid artist. To fabricate her art she currently uses a motorized device (pictures attached) that was made to tilt based on joystick commands. The pegs hold the inside frame of a stretched canvas and there are different holes to adjust for different size canvases. This device however does not have a big enough range of motion to allow the paint to flow like she would like and cannot accommodate larger canvases.

The task is to design a device that can tilt a platform as much as possible in every direction and can carry a large enough canvas for this client's needs. It must be operated with a joystick and must be easy to maintain and set up, It should be protected from any paint that may fall down. It should also be able to accommodate canvases of different shapes.

Title: GNG2101-B02.4-Talkbox-Soundgarden
Desc:
Problem statement:  The problem is that the client, an education assisting service, cannot provide microphones that have supported I/O to student devices such as newer laptops and tablets. The desired solution is a standalone streaming device that a student can bring to a class and integrate with the provided microphones to transmit audio to a captionist to assist students that are hard-of-hearing 
Solution: A self-contained product that connects to Zoom and streams received audio from classrooms via a raspberry pi that is accessed with a portable keypad and screen built into the casing. a battery is added o the bottom of the case.
Cost: $96.24

Title: ReadMe !
Desc:
Web application designed to assist blind individuals in reading medical tests. This application aims to provide a user-friendly interface that enables blind users to interpret and understand various medical test results. It utilizes advanced technologies to convert test results to synthesized speech and large contrasted print. We developed this application with accessibility in mind. üòä


1. Problem Motivation: ü§î


The problem we are solving is crucial as it concerns access to crucial information contained in specific tests such as COVID tests, maternity tests, and water pH tests. Currently, there is no application on the market that offers a solution tailored to these needs. This creates a significant gap in accessibility for individuals with visual impairments, such as blind, partially blind, or color-blind individuals. Our solution aims to provide a user-friendly and inclusive interface to enable a wide range of users to easily interpret the results of these tests, thus filling a crucial void in the field of accessibility applications. üôå


2. Basic User Requirements: üìù


Our application addresses the specific needs of people with visual difficulties by enabling the reading and understanding of color- or symbol-based test results. Features such as dark/light mode, adjustable fonts, good contrast, and appropriate colors are integrated to ensure an inclusive user experience. Additionally, the application offers extensive customization, allowing users to choose the type of test, display mode, and other settings based on their preferences. Test description features, result announcements, and notifications of optimal phone positioning add an additional layer of utility, making our application a comprehensive and accessible solution. üì±


3. Differentiation of Our Concept: üöÄ


What sets our application apart from other solutions on the market is its specific focus on accessibility for users with visual limitations. By offering a customizable interface, dark/light mode, adjustable fonts, and result announcement features, our application surpasses current alternatives that often limit themselves to generic textual descriptions of the environment. Our commitment to an inclusive user experience, combined with support for specific tests, makes our application the best option on the market for those seeking to independently interpret these tests. üòé

Title: Adapted Fitness Equipment - Team AdaptAble Rowing (GNG2021 A2.2)
Desc:
Our client is responsible for overseeing the weight and cardio room at the Jack Purcell community center and is looking for a modification to a rowing machine for wheelchair users. Using these interpreted needs, we have come up with a problem statement that defines what the problem is, who has the problem, and what form our solution comes in:

"There is a need at the Jack Purcell community center for a modification to a rowing machine in their weight room that allows wheelchair users to exercise with the machine without getting out of their wheelchair."

After prototyping and testing many ideas, we came up with our final product which can help a wide range of wheelchair users be more active which in turn promotes healthier lifestyles!

It includes features such as:
-Being lightweight
-Wall Mounting for easy storage
-Handle holder for user assistance so they don't have to reach out to grab the handle

*duct tape that was used for prototyping and pins were changed after design day to be more professional for an aesthetic look*

Title: GNG2501-FB2.4- ErgoDesk

Le tout nous ai revenu √† 75$.

Nous avons rencontr√© au d√©but un probl√®me lors de la conception du m√©canisme d'ajustement de la table car nous avions opt√© de partir de z√©ro. Apr√®s nous nous sommes rendu √† l'√©vidence qu'il serait id√©al de proc√©der par la modification de meubles au lieu de la cr√©ation compl√®te de nouveaux meubles. Title: GNG2101 2.1 Ergocares Innovations
Desc: Our project, the Renal Clamp Pliers, addresses critical challenges in healthcare, focusing on the well-being of caregivers, particularly renal care nurses facing arthritis risks due to repetitive tasks like clipping renal clamps. The innovative solution involves developing ergonomic and accessible clamp pliers to improve the work environment for healthcare professionals. The cost-effective, easy-to-clean, portable, and low-maintenance design aims to contribute to advancing healthcare practices. While replicating our design, individuals may encounter challenges related to material compatibility and 3D printing precision, emphasizing the importance of meticulous attention to detail in the designing process.

Title: GNG-1103 Section B Hinge Jig Group 18
Desc: Ambico, a door manufacturing company needs a jig to aid in the drilling of holes/tapping of their doors. It is our task to create a reusable, reliable jig(s) that is easy to operate that will fit the dimensions of the door hinge and backset, with the proper arrangement of holes for drilling/tapping. We have designed this Jig to speed up the drilling and tapping process and be an efficient tool for them to use in the workspace. The doors they manufactured are either fully steel or wood clad. Wood clad doors are steel doors wrapped in wood veneer. For this project, we have been tasked with creating a jig(s) that will allow the laborers that install the door hinges in a more timely-manner by removing time spent precisely measuring.

Title: GNG2101-A4.5-Table Tweakers
Desc:
• Problem Statement: Our objective is to design an adjustable, versatile, & cost-efficient table for children with disabilities, specifically those with hindered motor skills, that can accommodate everyday tasks & be compatible with a wheelchair.
  • Solution: Our solution features an H-frame base for stability, adjustable legs with aluminum rods for height variation, and a sliding mechanism secured with pins for easy customization. This design addresses the client's needs for a versatile, user-friendly table that caters to different height requirements and ensures stability during use. 
  • Cost: ~$100
  • Important details/struggles that people may face while duplicating our design: When attempting to replicate our design, individuals may encounter specific challenges. For instance, the 3D printed wheel adapters' compatibility relies on the wheelbase measurements, potentially requiring customization. Milling the holes in the aluminum beams for the table legs demands precision and might pose difficulties in replication. Determining the tabletop size is critical, influencing the attachment method to the legs. These details highlight the importance of careful consideration and accurate measurements during the duplication process.

Title: R√©sultats Des Tests Accessibles
Desc:
1. C'est Quoi Le Probl√®me?
Les personnes avec des troubles de la vision ont de la difficult√© √† lire et comprendre les r√©sultats des tests rapides √† la maison de fa√ßon confidentielle. Pour rem√©dier √† ceci, nous allons cr√©er une application mobile qui permet de reconna√Ætre le r√©sultat fourni par le test et de les communiquer √† l‚Äôutilisateur. 


2. Les Exigences Des Utilisateurs?
Les d√©ficiences de vue m√®nent √† une grande difficult√© de lire leurs r√©sultats proprement. Cela est tr√®s probl√©matique puisque cela oblige de l'assistance d‚Äôun interm√©diaire. Nous sommes au courant que vous, comme tous, aimez votre solitude. Ces r√©sultats contiennent des informations confidentielles, un tierce n‚Äôappartient pas dans l‚Äô√©quation.

Pour r√©soudre, ACCESS-19 garantit aux utilisateurs une exp√©rience accessible en adaptant notre produit pour la compatibilit√© enti√®re avec les nombreux param√®tres d'accessibilit√© int√©gr√©s sur votre dispositif IOS/Android. Par exemple, le Text-to-Speech est capable de lire tous les textes pr√©sents sur la page. Non seulement, la page s‚Äôadapte aux modifications de police aussi. La navigation fluide est une priorit√© pour nous, l‚Äôapplication a √©t√© con√ßue pour avoir le moins d‚Äôinteractions possible dans une interface visuellement adapt√©e avant de faire la lecture de tests. Permettant des transitions ais√©es entre les pages.


3. Pourquoi Nous?

Title: Motionworks BTD ‚Äì 1
Desc: Wheelchair users with limited mobility do not have an easy way to access their belongings. There are currently no products on the market that allow users to access their belongings without extensive movement of their arms and hands. The BTD - 1 provides a motorized solution with a storage box capable of holding books and a laptop. Once the user retrieves their belongings, the storage box also functions as a tray table for the user to work off of.

Title: GNG1503-FB31-LightBearing
Desc:
(FR) La compagnie GBS (General Bearing Service Inc) a eu besoin d'un produit pouvant identifier le num√©ro de s√©rie d'un roulement possiblement bris√© √† partir de photos. Notre prototype est form√© d'une entit√© physique facilitant la prise de photo du roulement. Ensuite, l'entit√© logiciel, programm√© avec le langage Python, analyse cette photo, mesure les dimensions n√©cessaires et trouve les roulements qui correspondent en cherchant parmi une base de donn√©es. 
Le programme est modulaire et bilingue.

(EN) The company GBS (General Bearing Service Inc) needed a product that could identify the serial number of a possibly broken bearing from photos. Our prototype is made up of a physical entity making it easier to take a photo of the bearing. Then, the software entity, programmed with the Python language, analyzes this photo, measures the necessary dimensions, and finds the matching bearings by searching through a database. 
The program is modular and bilingual.

Title: FB 32 - Hachem & co
Desc: Le "SKF Bearing Identifier" permet aux utilisateurs de mesurer les dimensions des roulements de mani√®re pr√©cise et de les soumettre pour identification via deux m√©thodes principales. Cette flexibilit√© offre une grande commodit√© et r√©pond aux diff√©rents styles de travail des utilisateurs. La premi√®re m√©thode est le t√©l√©chargement de photos : les utilisateurs peuvent utiliser leur t√©l√©phone portable ou tout autre appareil photo pour capturer des images des roulements et de leurs dimensions, prises √† l'aide de l'application de mesure "AR Ruler". Par la suite, ils t√©l√©versent l‚Äôimage dans l‚Äôinterface du Le "SKF Bearing Identifier" et ce dernier fournit la d√©signation du roulement correspondant.  La seconde m√©thode est la saisie manuelle, o√π les utilisateurs entrent directement les dimensions du roulement (diam√®tre int√©rieur, diam√®tre ext√©rieur, largeur) -obtenues par l'application de mesure "AR Ruler" ou disponibles pr√©alablement chez l‚Äôutilisateur- dans l'interface du "SKF Bearing Identifier". Cette option est id√©ale pour les utilisateurs qui pr√©f√®rent une approche plus traditionnelle ou lorsque les dimensions sont d√©j√† connues ou imprim√©es sur le roulement. Ce choix d‚Äôoptions offre une flexibilit√© significative, permettant aux utilisateurs de choisir la m√©thode la plus adapt√©e √† leur situation sp√©cifique.

Title: Wheelchair Brush Cleaner
Desc:
Introducing the Wheelchair Slush Cleaner, a revolutionary handbrush designed specifically for our client, Ottawa Foyers Partage. 

With its ergonomic handle and thoughtfully angled bristles, this cleaner allows for effortless access to hard-to-reach areas of wheelchairs. Its design considers the unique needs of both caregivers and individuals with disabilities, ensuring a comfortable grip and easy maneuverability.

This innovative cleaning tool is crafted with accessibility and reliability in mind, streamlining the cleaning process, maintaining cleanliness, and improving the comfort of wheelchair users at OFP.

Title: Academic Avengers - Identificateur de Roulement
Desc:
Le propri√©taire de General Bearing Services, Mitch Bouchard, a besoin d‚Äôun outil informatique simple d‚Äôutilisation qui sera utilis√© par
son personnel afin d‚Äôoptimiser leur temps lors de l‚Äôidentification de diff√©rents types de roulements lorsqu‚Äôun client arrive avec un roulement.

Ainsi, un programme pouvant √™tre utilis√© √† l'aide d'une cam√©ra sera d√©velopp√© afin d'identifier les roulements les plus similaires √† celui devant √™tre identifi√©. La cam√©ra pourra mesurer les dimensions int√©rieures et ext√©rieures du roulement tandis-que les autres caract√©ristiques du roulement pourront √™tre inscrites manuellement par l'utilisateur.

Un budget de 50$ CA sera respect√© lors du d√©veloppement du programme et du support de cam√©ra.

Afin de bien identifier les dimensions du roulement √† l'aide d'appareil photo, le roulement devra se situer au milieu de la photo, tandis-que l'objet servant d'√©chelle, un rectangle de dimensions connues, devra se trouver pr√®s du roulement.
Par ailleurs, l'image utilis√©e devrait avoir le moins d'ombrage que possible pour que le programme puisse identifier le roulement avec le plus de pr√©cision que possible.

Title: GNG 2501 - FB2.2 - SuperRaiser
Desc:
Parents with physical or visual impairments often lack affordable and practical solutions for lifting their children from the ground to higher positions such as strollers or high chairs. Existing lift devices for adults are typically large, hydraulic, and costly leaving a gap in accessible and affordable options for caregiving tasks. This is why we are designing a child lift for said parents to have a safe and affordable way to lift their child from the ground and vice-versa.

Les parents souffrant de d√©ficiences physiques ou visuelles manquent souvent de solutions pratiques et abordables pour soulever leurs enfants du sol et les transporter √† des positions plus √©lev√©es, comme une poussette ou une chaise haute. Les dispositifs de haussements existant pour les adultes sont g√©n√©ralement volumineux, hydrauliques et co√ªteux, ce qui laisse un vide en mati√®re d'options accessibles et abordables pour les t√¢ches de soins. Voila pourquoi nous avons d√©cid√© de concevoir un l√®ve-enfant pour permettre aux parents de disposer d'un moyen s√ªr et abordable de soulever leur enfant du sol et vice-versa.

Title: GNG2101-B1.4-ScrewU
Desc:
The staff at Bethany Children‚Äôs Health Center, a paediatric rehabilitation centre,  have requested a device be made; this device should be able to transport snacks across a counter with the push of a button, to accommodate patients with limited dexterity. The purpose of this device is to promote independence in the day-to-day tasks of those patients at Bethany Children's Health Center. Further, considering that the main users of this device will be children, the design must be simple and intuitive.
To address these needs, we aim to develop an accessible, affordable, and functional conveyor belt.  Utilizing this conveyor belt design, with the push of a button, patients at Bethany Children's Health Center will be able to efficiently transport snacks. 
Further, this project is operating under a price limit of $100.

Title: GNG1103-A0413-Everlasting Circle
Desc:
Deliverable A: This was focused on organizing the team. We carried out planning for how the project would unfold and be completed over the course of the term.

Deliverable B: This deliverable was focused on developing the Problem Statement for our Client's problem, and this was done by identifying our Client's needs.

Deliverable C: This deliverable was focused on completing benchmarking and filling out Design Criteria for the completion of our Project and the procurement of a solution for our Client.

Deliverable D: This deliverable was focused on developing designs that would be the basis for future prototypes and other deliverables (such as user manuals for our final product design and solution).

Deliverable E: This deliverable was focused on carrying out project planning for the rest of our Deliverable submissions and overall Project Completion Trajectory. We carried out project risk and mitigation planning and other planning that would set us up for success in future prototyping deliverables, and for Design Day.

Deliverable F:  This was our groups first prototyping deliverable, which focused on incorporating feedback from our Clients on our previous design, which was presented to them during our third Client Meeting. We also outlined our Testing Plan for the next prototype that we would develop for the next deliverable.

Deliverable G:  This was our groups second prototyping deliverable, which focused on implementing feedback and testing on our First Prototype (which was a Physical and Comprehensive one) to our New and Improved Prototype (which was Analytical and Comprehensive). We also outlined our Testing Plan for the next and final prototype that we would develop for the next deliverable, and ahead of Design Day.

Deliverable H: This was our groups third prototyping deliverable, which focused on refining feedback all while implementing what was being discussed with the client.

Deliverable I: This was the design day presentation submission. Our group worked to present our prototypes and countless hours of work to both the client, users/customers and peers.

Deliverable J: This was our group's presentation to our Professor and Course Classmates, acting as a summary of the project that we had completed, including details on the Functional Solution we created, the decisions made during the project, challenges faced, and lessons learned from the project.

Deliverable K: This was the User & Product Manual, acting as a detailed summary and guideline on the function and use of the Functional Solution we had procured for our clients, and included technical information on various aspects of the design we had completed and the comprehensive descriptions of every system, subsystem, and element in our design.

Title: GNG1103-Group 10-Loose Screws
Desc:
Our vision of the Guardian Building was designed in collaboration with Algonquins of Pikwakanagan First Nation. Our one-story, accessible, and functional building was created with the values and culture of the associates in mind. To provide a feeling of community, our building was built surrounding a courtyard intended as an outdoor meeting area for collaboration. The floorplan of our main building includes:
-office spaces
-a boardroom
-a common room
-a laboratory
-a lean-to
-storage rooms
-a kitchenette
-restrooms

Adjacent to the building is a parking area for both recreational and commercial vehicles. Additionally, there is an outdoor activity area provided for company or community events. Overall, the purpose of this building is to maintain connection within the community and provide a space for cultural harvesting and processing.

Title: GNG2501 - FA01.5 - ParaPicture Solutions
Desc:
** Vid√©o de d√©monstration dans les fichiers de projet **

Description du Probl√®me:
Les personnes en chaise roulante font face √† des d√©fis uniques lorsqu'elles souhaitent pratiquer la photographie. Les supports de cam√©ra traditionnels ne sont souvent pas adapt√©s √† leurs besoins sp√©cifiques en termes de mobilit√© et de positionnement. Il est essentiel de d√©velopper une solution qui soit √† la fois solide pour assurer la stabilit√© de la cam√©ra, et suffisamment flexible pour s'adapter √† diff√©rentes positions et angles de prise de vue.


Solution Propos√©e:
Nous avons con√ßu un support de cam√©ra innovant qui combine √† la fois solidit√© et flexibilit√©. La structure principale du support est fabriqu√©e √† partir d'un tube lamin√© √† froid, offrant une base robuste. Des pi√®ces sp√©cifiques ont √©t√© cr√©√©es √† l'aide d'imprimantes 3D, permettant une personnalisation facile et une adaptabilit√© aux divers mod√®les d'appareils photo. De plus, un bras flexible int√©gr√© au support offre une grande vari√©t√© d'angles de prise de vue, tandis qu'un support de t√©l√©phone int√©gr√© permet une utilisation polyvalente avec diff√©rents dispositifs.


Co√ªt de la Solution:
La mise en ≈ìuvre de cette solution novatrice a un co√ªt maximal de 75$. Par contre, nous avons seulement utilis√© 59,11 $. Ce co√ªt inclut les mat√©riaux utilis√©s tels que le tube lamin√© √† froid, le filament pour l'impression 3D, ainsi que les composants n√©cessaires pour le bras flexible et le support de t√©l√©phone. Cette solution offre une alternative abordable et efficace pour r√©pondre aux besoins des personnes en chaise roulante passionn√©es de photographie.
La nomenclature de mat√©riaux de notre projets ce trouve dans les fichiers de projet. 


D√©fi Principal:
Le d√©fi majeur de ce projet r√©side dans la recherche d'un √©quilibre parfait entre la flexibilit√© et la solidit√© du support. Il est crucial que le support puisse maintenir fermement la cam√©ra dans diff√©rentes positions tout en √©tant assez flexible pour s'adapter aux pr√©f√©rences individuelles des utilisateurs en chaise roulante. La conception doit garantir la s√©curit√© de l'√©quipement tout en offrant une exp√©rience photographique fluide et adaptable.

Title: GNG2501-Groupe FA01.1-SoundScape Android
Desc:
The client seeks an application capable of audibly guiding visually deficient people around town, as well as being able to mark down specific locations and points of interest to remember itineraries or different entities in the world.
So we made an application that can track a user's location, and mark down intersections, points of interest, or destinations, as well as play haptics when the user gets near.
Le client recherche une application capable de guider de mani√®re audible les personnes malvoyantes √† travers la ville, ainsi que de marquer des endroits et des points d'int√©r√™t sp√©cifiques pour m√©moriser des itin√©raires ou diff√©rentes entit√©s du monde.
Nous avons donc cr√©√© une application capable de suivre la position de l'utilisateur, de marquer les intersections, les points d'int√©r√™t ou les destinations, ainsi que de jouer un haptique lorsqu'un utilisateur s'approche.

Title: Soundpath - GNG2501 - FA01.2

SoundPath est une application con√ßue pour assister une personne qui a un trouble de vision lors d'un voyage √† l'ext√©rieur. L'application permet de cr√©er une route dans le monde r√©el en d√©posant des marqueurs personnalis√©s avec l'assistance d'une personne qui n'a pas de trouble de vision, pour ensuite reparcourir la route en recevant des rappels auditifs r√©guliers sur la distance et la direction des marqueurs. Les marqueurs peuvent √™tre cr√©√©s pour indiquer des magasins, des panneaux, des intersections ou d'autres points d'int√©r√™t.

Title: footRover - Team A5.1 GNG2101
Desc:
The footRover is a foot mouse that was created to allow a disabled individual to use his computer more efficiently. It was built with functionality, accessibility and sustainability in mind. 

For the code, we used a Raspberry Pi Pico W coded with the Arduino IDE in C. The code allows for direct connection to any computer without any drivers, this is possible since the Raspberry Pi Pico W acts as a HID device. The code was adapted and expanded from one found https://www.instructables.com/Raspberry-Pi-Pico-As-HID-Mouse/ .

We designed the housing in solidworks, it was the exported to DXF, opened in solidworks and cut using the laser cuter. It has special button holes that allow for easy twist and remove. 

Video link https://drive.google.com/file/d/1oBZ6K9eg95rZZ1xGrCxbj3rJeFCTE7RW/view?usp=sharing

Title: GameAbility
Desc:
As part of the GNG2101 course, we held meetings with our client who loves playing videos games and has significant tremors. As a member of the Tetra Society he shared his concerns with us regarding the current adapted controllers available. He would like us to design a robust, programmable and accessible remote controller that is compatible with both Xbox and PC for disabled gamers. Thus, by using conceptual thinking, we created a product called ¬´ X-Ability ¬ª which is a functional and accessible controller for gamers with limited mobility. The cost of this project is approximately $100.

Title: Cup Daddy - Secure Cup Holder
Desc: The client has cerebral palsy and keeps knocking their cup off of their wheelchair tray. They requested a designed component that stops the cup from being knocked over. Our design consists of a clamp made from aluminum and a 3D printed component which slots onto the clamp and secures the cup.

Title: The FFF's One Handed Walker Steering Component
Desc: The Fast and Fabricating Five created a system that allows for walkers to be steered with one arm. This system was specifically meant for our client to steer her walker with one hand as she has hypermobile Ehlers Danlos syndrome which is a genetic connective tissue disorder. Meaning she had the need for a walker that allows her to steer with either arm as any one of her shoulders can dislocate. Our system allows for easy maneuverability as there is one bar that supports her weight and one bar that she can use for steering. The bar meant for steering can be placed anywhere across the first bar allowing for easy adjustments when any of her shoulders dislocate. The system can be easily removed so the seat can be accessible and the bars can bend in half for easy storing.

Title: Voice Controlled Reclining Chair Remote w/ Raspberry Pi
Desc:
In collaboration with Tetra Society of North America to create accessibility appliances for ALS patients

Countless patients suffer from muscle weakening related illnesses. In turn they are unable to operate the buttons or physical control interfaces. In this case recliners and medical chairs often can only be used by the care takers.

The solution is using machine learning to understand what the patient is saying. The product not only has the ability to learn and understand English, but rather any language or constant sound that can be reproduced and identifiable

The budget provided for this project is $150, out of which $149.60 was used

Title: Support for Vertical Storage of Catrikes
Desc:
Ref.: https://www.catrike.com/

A supporting base to assist in the vertical storage of "tadpole" style recumbent trikes (aka "Catrike") using the trike's tadpole's hub as the main support point.  The design must support the weight of the trike, must protect the front gear and chain, must prevent the hub from slipping out and must be easy for the trike to slip in and out.  May have a bungee strap to secure the base to the trike.  May have wheels to maneuver the base+trike into position against the wall, yet the wheels would need to be lockable to prevent movement once in its storage location.

Title: Personal Tracking Ecosystem Group B
Desc: Air pollution is a serious threat to public health and the environment. The use of low-cost, portable air pollution sensors has been suggested to address this issue by providing a decentralized system to measure air quality. This project aimed to design a system that can measure air pollution using low-cost sensors, visualize and analyze the collected data, and make recommendations for improving air quality. However, due to time and budget constraints, the project was limited to building a system with two pollution sensors, GPS, and Wi-Fi modules. The client's requirements were categorized into price, climate conditions, and hardware requirements. The team faced some difficulties during the practical part of the project, but they were able to collect and visualize data. In the next parts of this report, the components and hardware of the system will be introduced, and the data collected will be visualized. Finally, the different scopes of scalability, usability, functionality, and quality of this project will be discussed.

Title: Creating a Pollution Measuring Sensor Network for E-Bikes with Real-Time Data Collection and Data Visualization
Desc:
Because of a variety of natural and man-made phenomena, harmful materials called air pollutants are repeatedly introduced into the atmosphere due to a wide range of chemical and physical processes. These pollutants are then largely distributed due to air patterns and wind cycles gradually spreading throughout the atmosphere. These pollutants can arise naturally like volcanic ash or by virtue of man-made sources like factories, automobiles, aircrafts, landfills, wastewater, maintenance holes, and leaking natural gas infrastructure. These air pollutants predominantly comprise of Ozone, CO2, Carbon monoxide, NOx, sulphur dioxide, VOCs, lead, and oxides of sulphur which can have detrimental effects on human health such as cardiovascular and respiratory diseases, and pulmonary diseases like lung cancer. This makes it essential to study and monitor the distribution of these pollutants in the atmosphere and moreover, identify and analyze the sources of air pollution to curb this worldwide issue. 
 
As the old saying goes, modern problems require modern solutions. Therefore, to tackle present- day issues of air pollution, it is important to focus on rapid gathering of data pertaining to the local distribution of air pollutants in the atmosphere. This would help us determine the sources of air pollution and enable us to find ways to control the emission of these hazardous pollutants into the environment.

The Canadian Ambient Air Quality Standards (CAAQS) as established under the Canadian Environment Protection Act 1999 are a key aspect of Air Quality Management System (AQMS) which navigates the improvement of Air Quality across Canada. These standards have been developed for fine particulate matter (PM2.5), nitrogen dioxide (NO2), sulphur dioxide (SO2), and ozone (O3) in particular. Industries, non-governmental and indigenous organizations, using assistance from the federal government, set up air monitoring stations.

Provinces and territories monitor these criteria air pollutants and annually record the air quality to document air quality concerns and trends, and the achievement of CAAQS for each air zone. This is done using measuring instruments called Federal Reference Methods or Reference Monitors.

However, data collected from specific locations (e.g., Local airports and fixed weather stations) are not fully representative of the ambient conditions in local neighborhoods due to variations in elevation, vegetation, and heat/waste coming from automobiles, factories and residential buildings. Moreover, fixed weather stations provide an area-averaged quantitative understanding of pollution levels. In contrast to this, remote sensing provides real-time data on land cover with better spatial resolution and comparatively lower costs, and this is the basis for our project.

Title: AHL 3100 - TEAM 7 - Sustainable Newtsuits
Desc: In a world where climate change has caused rising sea levels and unstable weather conditions, there could be a chance that one day, humans will look to underwater living as a means of development. This new and improved version of the newtsuit introduces the Yulex natural rubber compound as the exterior and interior shell to go along with an aluminum alloy body, protecting divers who will navigate deep water. The projected cost of this project will be $50.

Title: DTI6304-T1-Future Barbie
Desc: Barbie, as a toy, has delivered significant social, political, and environmental messages over 80 years. In a world that concerns about plastic wastes, environmental issues, and gender inequality arise, Barbie has the potential to demonstrate the possible changes that it can bring to the complex environmental and gender problems. This project aims to envision the future of Barbie with the considerations of the sustainable goals in gender and environment/material. The cost of the project is minimum (<$100). The challenge of the design is to be visible, artistic, and thought-provoking in order to use a concrete physical object to convey relatively abstract messages.

Title: FB21 - ServerSight Alpha1
Desc:
Notre √©quipe √† cr√©√© une boite de surveillance pour salle de serveurs. Ce projet √† √©t√© r√©alis√© dans le cadre du cours GNG1503. Nous nous sommes bas√©s sur trois id√©es principales : simplicit√©, redondance et durabilit√©!

Nous avons pu √©tablir l'√©nonc√© du probl√®me suivant.
¬´ Concevoir pour services partag√©s canada, un syst√®me de surveillance de temp√©rature, d'humidit√© et de qualit√© de l'air √† placer dans une salle de serveur, qui permettra de donner des alertes en temps r√©el aux clients, en cas de changements de environnementaux. ¬ª

Le co√ªt total des pi√®ces utilis√©s pour notre projet √©tait d'environ 88$ taxes incluses.

Nous avons rencontrer quelques probl√®mes lors de la r√©alisation des prototypes. Le plus significatifs c'est pr√©sent√© lors de l'installation des pilotes (drivers) pour le micro-controleur ESP32. Voici quelques astuces pour d'autres √©quipes qui aurait de la difficult√©. Premi√®rement, s'assurer d'utiliser un cable micro-usb qui accepte le transfert de donn√©es. Ensuite, installer les Cp210x universal windows drivers √† l'aide du lien suivant : https://www.silabs.com/developers/usb-to-uart-bridge-vcp-drivers?tab=downloads 

Extraire les fichiers et ouvrir device manager. Choisir le p√©riph√©rique dans la liste, et right click pour update drivers. Choisir ¬´ Select from my computer¬ª, puis next et have disk. Trouver le ficher .inf dans le dossier que l'on vient d'extraire. Ensuite, les biblioth√®ques appropri√©s (Espressif ESP32) et le bon module (ESP32 Dev Module) peuvent √™tre selectionn√©s dans Arduino IDE. ATTENTION: il faut s'assurer de ne pas utiliser la version la plus r√©cente des biblioth√®ques du ESP32. En date d'avril 2023 celles-ci pr√©sentent des probl√®mes.

Title: DTI6304-Group2-Biomimic-OctoSuit
Desc:
The deep diving suit was chosen as an artifact from the Ingenium collection and we studied the present and past of the suit. The goal is to redesign the deep diving suit for the future. (e.g. 2040). Studying the suit over time and space, we asked several questions; why do humans like to go underwater? How does knowledge develop? and from the embodied point of view, how does the suit influence our experiences underwater?
These questions led us to some philosophical theories such as phenomenology and existentialism. Asking philosophical, engineering, and ethical questions and searching for "whys" changed the way we thought about diving suits and we asked, "how do animals underwater do?" and we came up with the idea of a Biomimetic robot. Among various animals, "Octopus" drew our attention because we saw incredible flexibility, curiosity, and creativity in this animal (these characteristics reminded us of our species). We are passionate about sustainability and our design covers UNSDG 12, 9 and 14. Accordingly, we designed a Biomimic-OctoSuit, that can be used both underwater and in the air. (the legs can work both for moving underwater and as wings out of water). Since this project is carried out in collaboration with the science museum, we also designed a piece of artwork (a mimetic octopus leg) to symbolize the extraordinary flexibility, curiosity, and creativity of future diving suits.

Title: GNG1103 - F31 - Troubleshooters
Desc:
Autonomous weapons raise several moral and ethical concerns that decision makers need to be made aware of. It is important for decision makers to start negotiations on these weapon systems before they are available for use. However, politicians and diplomats still see this issue as theoretical, and they don‚Äôt see how such a revolution in warfare would have a major impact on many individuals.

Our task was to design a virtual reality experience that shows the ethical and moral issues that autonomous weapons raise. We had to take this problem from the abstract side and make it into reality for decision makers.

Title: GNG-1103-F21-Stop Killer Robots VR Experience
Desc:
Note: The Bill of Materials in the earlier deliverables is outdated. Please refer to the complete bill in the User/Product Manual.

Problem Statement: Create a VR experience on behalf of Mines Action Canada and wider the Stop Killer Robots campaign to highlight the ethical concerns surrounding autonomous weapons and to bring the issue from being seen as theoretical to being realistic and presently relevant for decision-makers.

Solution: We are creating a VR experience using the Unity engine and the Steam VR plugin. This experience shows that autonomous weapons should not be used by emphasizing that autonomous weapons see people in terms of code instructions and data, and are therefore both more prone to discrimination and cannot see clearly through the fog of war. There is a secondary focus on emphasizing that such weapons are not only possible to build, but already close to battlefield-ready in our modern day and age; this is to show that the issue is urgent and not to be ignored.

Cost: The project will cost between $50 and $150 in 3D Assets, with the range existing in order to span a wide array of asset quality. Higher-quality assets will cost significantly more money than lower-quality assets, though based on the target quality of your simulation, higher quality assets may not be needed for everything (i.e. background environment in the distance can be lower quality without impacting the experience significantly, but any objects and environments the user interacts with must be higher quality, hence the $50 budget floor).

Concerns during production: This project may be time intensive for anyone attempting to replicate it. Cooperation may be tedious (or cost money due to the nature of Unity's Plastic version control system) in larger groups.

Title: GNG 2501 - FB3.1 - H√©ro√Øne du Faso
Desc:
L‚Äôassociation veut disposer d‚Äôune application mobile fonctionnant sur Android ou iOS afin de promouvoir la Sant√© Sexuelle et Reproductive adapt√©e aux Adolescents et aux Jeunes (SSRAJ).  

Elle permettra aux jeunes filles ou femmes d‚Äôavoir un cadre d‚Äô√©change priv√© ou public. Elles discuteront de mani√®re anonyme ou pas entre elles et aussi avec des experts du domaine de la sant√©. L'application sera √©galement une vitrine de d√©nonciation des violences bas√©es sur le genre. Ces discussions se pr√©senteront sur plusieurs formats : texte, voix ou vid√©o. 
La t√¢che consiste √† concevoir cette application avec deux espaces :  

  • Un espace public : Il donne un aper√ßu sur les diff√©rentes rubriques de l‚Äôapplication. Il est possible d‚Äôidentifier les centres de sant√© les plus proches, d‚Äô√™tre inform√©s des √©v√®nements en lien avec la sant√© sexuelle et reproductive (campagne de d√©pistage, consultations gratuites, atelier‚Ä¶). Il dispose √©galement d'un moteur de gestion du cycle menstruel qui permettra √† chaque femme ou fille de mieux suivre son cycle et d‚Äô√©viter ainsi les grossesses non d√©sir√©es. 
  • Un espace priv√© : Chaque acteur du syst√®me dispose d‚Äôun espace priv√© sp√©cifique. Les acteurs de la sant√© n‚Äôauront pas les m√™mes fonctionnalit√©s que les utilisateurs clients. Il faut avoir un compte utilisateur pour y acc√©der. Les utilisateurs clients pourront ainsi participer aux discussions ou cr√©er des √©changes avec les autres acteurs du syst√®me comme des agents de sant√©. L‚Äôadministrateur syst√®me aura ainsi des statistiques sur toutes les donn√©es de l‚Äôapplication. Cet espace permet de r√©aliser le travail de v√©rification des informations soumises par les tiers, mais aussi de veiller √† l‚Äôanonymat des personnes qui les soumettent. Il permet √©galement d‚Äôalimenter certaines rubriques comme le blog, les √©v√®nements (conf√©rences, formations ‚Ä¶). 
L‚Äôapplication doit aussi √™tre en fran√ßais, il doit √™tre facile √† naviguer et d‚Äôutiliser l‚Äôapplication, car certains des utilisateurs ont des difficult√©s √† lire et √©crire.

Title: GNG1103-GroupeC6-Dusters
Desc: A malt and level sensor system is a device used to measure and monitor the level of malt in a brewing vessel or storage tank. This system typically consists of sensors that are installed at various points in the tank or vessel, which provide real-time data on the amount of malt present. The data collected by the system is transmitted to a control unit, which can be used to adjust the brewing process or to trigger alarms in the event of any anomalies. This type of sensor system is crucial in ensuring the consistency and quality of the brewing process, and can help brewers optimize their operations for maximum efficiency.

Title: GNG1103-C8
Desc: We were presented with the task of creating a software for the Mill St. Brewery Company in order to optimize the conveyors for their production line. The proposed design consists of an app that is able to take input data from files and is able to analyze this data, and then create recommendations for the user operating the system.

Title: GNG1103-C7-Convey
Desc: Mill Street Brewery needs a programmed interface that allows the user to impute system and conveyor speeds, resulting in the identification of various regions where the process isn‚Äôt running optimally. The product should be usable offline, set production line speeds according to V-curve theory, and result in an overall efficiency increase of at least 2%. In addition, the product will display flexibility by allowing the user to switch between different types of brewery lines (can, bottle, and keg).

Desc: Mill Street Brewery needs a programmed interface that allows the user to impute system and conveyor speeds, resulting in the identification of various regions where the process isn‚Äôt running optimally. Title: GNG1103-C10-2A.D.R.H
Desc: The client needs a dust level sensor to detect the amount of dust within their malt silos to prevent the dust clogging the system. This design uses an  photoresistor to detect the amount of reflected light. Then an ultrasonic sensor is used to measure the distance from the photoresistor to the top of the casing. This measurement is used to calculate the volume of malt in the silo. These sensors are attached to a belt so when a motor spins, the sensors move up and down the silo until the level of the malt is detected.

Our client has a need for a compact and light device to simulate a locking motion in his left elbow while ensuring proper support under continuous load, throughout symmetrical and static movements  

Our team used the concept of springs and storing energy to help our client complete pushups.

The budget for this project was 100$ initially and it was increased to 400$ later on in the semester.

Details to consider when trying to replicate this project would be to look into customs spring or other methods to store and convert energy to complete a push-up.

Title: GNG 2101[D] D3.2 - Wheely Good Transfer Device
Desc:
Everyday activities such as accessing a bag or backpack can be a struggle for wheelchair-bound individuals with limited upper body mobility.

The solution? A wheely good transfer device.

Our wheelchair backpack transfer device uses a mechanical solution. A steel pipe was bent to be fitted along one side and the back of the wheelchair. There is a lengthwise slit along the pipe rail, where the wheeled bag mounting component travels (similar to a curtain.) The user uses a pull cord to transfer their backpack from behind the wheelchair to the side of the wheelchair near the armrest, where it can easily be accessed. Once complete, the bag can be stowed to the back of the wheelchair once again. The Wheely Good Tranfer Devices helps to preserve independence in wheelchair users, and its mounting system is adjustable to account for different wheelchair dimensions.

It was a pleasure to work on this challenging project!

Link to On shape project: https://cad.onshape.com/documents/f4fbaf54bf64a51140e4ceca/w/5e5a8559f57383dcc6cfeab5/e/8716b3b6003a348bc8c3d2ff?renderMode=0&uiState=6426d517aba1556bc7d84396

https://youtu.be/pAOkjlCBi0o

Title: GNG1103-C15-Dust Sensor
Desc:
The project is a project that has the goal to create a working dust sensor design that pleases the needs of the client (Mills St. Brewery.) We defined the problem statement to be:
Design a dust sensing system that will detect the dust levels in malt silos that can withstand the silo conditions. The system will be able to display the current dust levels and warn the operator when the dust levels are approaching a set adjustable threshold. This will help avoid full system shutdowns in advance to keep the brewing process running efficiently. 
The solution to the problem statement was to create a device that uses a dust sensor connected to an Arduino. This device will have a case that consists of mesh, which will filter the supplements running through their system to detect the accurate dust concentration measurements. 
When creating the device may things have to be taken into account and assured to have the best functionality possible. One of the things to make sure when creating the device is to ensure that the airflow and filtering of the device is functional as build up might become an issue if the airflow is inefficient. Another thing to take into account when creating the device is that assurance of the functionality of the sensor and its measurements must be made to ensure that the correct measurements are being made to avoid a build up of dust. The device is fairly complex, but performs its job effectively. 

Arduino IDE, Inkscape, and MegunoLink were software used.

Title: GNG1103-C12-Dust_Sensor
Desc:
There exists a need for a wireless, low maintenance device capable of alerting operators when the measured dust concentration reaches a set threshold. The design must be adaptable to the existing system, and must communicate with the current user interface.

We created a device for the purpose of measuring dust concentration early in a brewing process line with the purpose of alerting the operators if there was a large enough amount of dust in the system that it could clog the line.

So, we chose to make a device that took a sample of the malt/dust mixture from the piping using a valve, then separated the two using a filter, and measured the volume of each to determine the concentration of dust.

It cost roughly  $77.68 (BOM is included in files).

Title: GNG1103-F23-Virtual Reality for Ban
Desc:
Problem Statement:  
Mines Action Canada needs an informative 2-5 minute virtual reality experience that evokes emotion and conveys the user to take a position opposing the use of autonomous weapons. The experience will not put focus on any specific parties and will be directed towards those who are uncertain regarding their point of view on autonomous weapons.

Solution: 
 The VR takes place in a small community where an invasion is taking place. The streets are deserted and full of destruction. The user is a citizen of the community trying to find the local bunker after everyone has fled. Autonomous drones are filling the sky and autonomous robots are creeping around. When the user finds the bunker, they will be able to talk to survivors and how the attack affected them, even though they are only civilians. Using risk education, the user will be informed about the dangers of autonomous weapons through various infographics and through speaking with civilians. 

 
Cost: $126

Title: Virtual Reality for anti-autonomous weapons
Desc: design a virtual reality experience for Mine Action Canada, the speaks to people around the world  including politicians and UN officials, about the dangers of autonomous weapons on humans, and seeks to stop developing and spreading these types of weapons. Autonomous weapons are unmanned controlled robots that identify and select targets based on specific details encoded to them.

Title: GNG 1103-F22-Virtual Reality For A Ban
Desc:
Problem Statement:
To create an informative virtual reality experience lasting 2-5 minutes which will persuade government officials and the public about the negative consequences behind autonomous weapons by creating emotion. 

Government officials and the public need a virtual reality experience which will persuade about the negative consequences behind autonomous weapons by creating emotion through a two-to-five-minute, storytelling design. 

Mines Action Canada need a 2‚Äì5-minute virtual reality experience which will persuade government officials and the public about the negative consequences behind autonomous weapons through an informative and emotional story-telling experience.

Solution:
Working together as a group of five we have one to two weekly meetings to discuss and work on the project.

Our idea is to create a storyline within unity that shows the negative impact autonomous weapons have by giving a scene where the user experiences life where autonomous weapons are used for everyday life.

After this scene we are giving the user the ability to speak out against what they saw and experienced to powerful people within the government.

Cost:
Our budget consists of a multitude of assets that help explain the storyline. Large buildings such as the office and the hospital cost $29.99. After buying the majority of our assets we have spend a total of $73.49

Problems Encountered During the Process:

After the first few deliverables and the prototype stage started we ran into the issue where we did not know how to share and edit other peoples unity projects. Once this was resolved we ran into a few more issues.

Creating and exporting the codes into the unity project was another issue we have run into. We watched a multitude of videos trying to help us work and speed up this process.

Title: JIBMM solutions
Desc:
LCO est en train de construire de nouveaux b√¢timents √† haute performance ainsi que de proc√©der √† des r√©novations √©nerg√©tiques profondes dans des b√¢timents existants. Ces b√¢timents fonctionnent diff√©remment et la performance de l'ensemble du b√¢timent b√©n√©ficie grandement du fait que chaque locataire effectue de petites actions dans ses unit√©s ou est averti en temps r√©el de certains √©v√©nements m√©caniques ou de ventilation en cours.

LCO cherche un service de messagerie SMS ou une application mobile que nos gestionnaires immobiliers pourraient utiliser en temps r√©el pour communiquer instantan√©ment avec chaque locataire qui s'inscrit dans le b√¢timent. En utilisant certaines caract√©ristiques de chaque unit√© (√©tage, exposition sud/nord, num√©ro d'unit√©), le gestionnaire immobilier pourrait √©galement envoyer des messages plus personnalis√©s. Id√©alement, certains de ces messages seraient √©galement automatis√©s en fonction de la temp√©rature ext√©rieure ou de l'heure de la journ√©e. Voici quelques exemples de messages possibles, mais il faudrait qu'ils soient suffisamment personnalisables pour une situation non encore anticip√©e:
  • Ouvrez vos fen√™tres ce soir pour laisser entrer de l'air frais et rafra√Æchir le b√¢timent
  • Un entrepreneur travaillera sur le syst√®me de ventilation ou les 2 prochaines heures, alors attendez-vous √† ce que votre ventilateur soit √©teint
Il y a trois morceaux principaux de ce projet, l'algorithme et analyse de donn√©es pour la d√©cision du contenu des messgaes, une base de donn√©e qui tiens les informations des locataires, de l'√©difice et de la m√©t√©o et le medium de communication avec les locataires. 

Comme premi√®re √©tape votre t√¢che est de concevoir l'application destin√©e aux locataires qui d√©livre la messagerie et interagit directement avec les locataires. Il devrait √™tre capable de se connecter √† une base de donn√©es et envoyer de l'information d'une mani√®re accessible et s√©curitaire. L'application devrait √™tre bilingue et facile √† utililser pour n'importe quel utilisateur de LCO.

Title: SolidWork MRI Project
Desc:
As part of a group project, we were asked to design and reproduce an MRI medical machine on SolidWork.

The project was to include 5 detachable parts that were individually produced on SolidWork. We were also asked to build a fully functional assembly from the individual parts. In addition, engineering drawings were to be produced for the individual parts and the whole assembly.

The MRI project was inspired by various other 3D MRI machine available on the internet. The measurement of the parts where based on an average human (1m80) since we did not have access to a real MRI machine for the project.

Full assembly , parts and Drawing can be provided upon request
