Title: OCR 3 Accesibility App Project
Desc:
During our academic tenure, a distinctive engineering course project called upon us to apply our engineering acumen to address a real-world problem. Our challenge was unique and profound: we were to empower a visually impaired individual, enhancing his independence and ease of carrying out daily tasks, particularly during the pandemic.


Navigating the grocery store had become a hurdle for our client, whose vision impairment prevented him from discerning price tags, ingredient lists, and other product details without external assistance. Our objective was clear; we had to listen empathetically, understand our client's needs and abilities, and devise a solution that amplified his autonomy.


The key to our solution lay within the information shared by our client. He had an IOS device he used routinely, relying on Spoken Content & Audio Description, the IOS accessibility features. He was also capable of discerning neon shades and differentiating shapes.


Armed with this information, our engineering team crafted 'OCR 3', an ingenious application operating on the Microsoft Power Apps platform. This tool was not just an app; it was an embodiment of our commitment to leveraging technology to bridge accessibility gaps.


OCR 3 harnessed the power of optical character recognition, transforming images into textual content. Users could then leverage the Text-to-Speech feature, which vocalized the extracted text, or save it to the clipboard for future reference. Moreover, our app held the ability to isolate and present the price from an image, a functionality tailored for our client's shopping needs.


But the thoughtfulness in our design did not end there. Keeping our client's preferences at the forefront, we incorporated 'flashy' colours, large, easily distinguishable buttons, and a simple, user-friendly interface. In every way, OCR 3 was a testament to empathetic engineering, designed to make life a little easier for those navigating the world with visual impairment.

Title: ELG 3336 - Automated Fire Truck 2022
Desc:
As part of a university course (ELG 3336, University of Ottawa), we were asked to design and implement a mechatronics project.

For this project, we were asked to include a data acquisition system and 3 sensors.

We then purchased a robot from Amazon that we assembled and modified to our needs. 

The microcontroller used for the project is from Keyestudio with the DC control shield and sensor shield, we then added an IR sensor, a brightness sensor and an ultrasonic sensor. We also included a fan to turn off the fire when it is detected. 

We then coded the robot to perform the following tasks:

1. fire detection (using the fire sensor)
2. autonomous driving
3. Flame detection (using the IR sensor)
4. Extinguish the flame when it is detected

Title: Automated Fire Truck Project
Desc:
In the context of the course ELG 3336 at the prestigious University of Ottawa, my team and I undertook a complex and demanding mechatronics project that required an innovative blend of mechanical engineering, electronics, and computer science.


Our task was to conceptualize, design, and build a multi-functional robot. For this purpose, we sourced a customizable robot kit from Amazon, which we expertly assembled and modified according to our specifications.


To ensure effective data acquisition, we incorporated a dynamic system and three distinct sensors into our design. The sensor suite included an infrared (IR) sensor for flame detection, a brightness sensor for light intensity measurement, and an ultrasonic sensor for distance measurement and obstacle detection, providing our robot with a broad spectrum of environmental awareness.


The core of our robot's processing capabilities lay in the Keyestudio microcontroller we used. This was complemented with a DC control shield and a sensor shield to enable effective sensor data reading and motor control. To further enhance our robot's functionality and safety measures, we introduced an innovative feature - a fan that could activate and extinguish a detected fire, positioning our creation as a potential life-saving tool.


The hardware setup was only one aspect of our project. On the software side, we dove into coding the robot to perform a variety of tasks autonomously. We developed algorithms for fire detection, autonomous navigation, flame detection using the IR sensor, and automatic fire extinguishing.


This combination of hardware and software culminated in a highly capable autonomous system that could react to its environment and take decisive actions, embodying the true essence of a mechatronics project.


We maintain comprehensive documentation of our project, and upon request, we can provide a full project report detailing our journey and findings throughout this project. For those interested in the specifics of the robot's programming, we have made our Arduino code available under 'Project Files'.


This project encapsulates our technical proficiency, teamwork, problem-solving, and our commitment to utilizing technology for safety and convenience.

Title: Hover - An Automatic Frisbee Thrower
Desc:
Hover is a GNG 2101 team that was given four months to design a frisbee thrower from scratch. This thrower is intended for children with special needs who do not have the motor skills required to throw a frisbee.

Our frisbee thrower is like nothing on the market. It is a compact design with a height adjustable mechanism, which allows for optimal and changeable distances. Combine that with our high efficiency motor and changeable speed controls, and you're left with a product that not only launches a frisbee, but one that consistently and successfully launches variable frisbee sizes at regulative distances. In addition, the safety measures we have implemented in our design ensures that we have dramatically decreased the opportunity for injury.

Title: GNG1103-B04-The brewskis
Desc: As requested by our client "beyond the pale", we designed a product that was able to measure the specific gravity during the beer brewing process. We had one goal in mind: A need exists for beer brewers to automatically measure and display the specific gravity of their brew during the fermentation process on a routine basis, with a sustainable budget. ‚ÄãOur design operates on the use of two pressure sensors, and one temperature sensor, while running a code using an arduino microcontroller and attached to the tank. We estimated that our product will cost roughly 98.82 .

Title: GNG1103-B1-Brewery Uno
Desc: The problem our device seeks to solve is that Beyond the Pale Brewing Company needs to precisely and automatically measure the specific gravity of their fermentation process with an attached device that displays real-time data remotely, is easy to use, and can be removed for cleaning. Our device will accomplish this with a pressure sensor that will derive density and then specific gravity from the pressure readings in the tank. It will then transmit data via Bluetooth to an app on a device in the brewery to view and store the data. The total cost of the project design is $79.68. Challenges that may be faced when undergoing this project are effectively waterproofing the sensors and Arduino so they aren't damaged by the fermenting liquid and logging data graphically through an Arduino, which requires external code not written in C++. A detailed report along with .stl files for CAD models can be found under Project Files.

Title: GNG1103-B2-Baby Santa
Desc: The problem statement for our project is to Build a tool that measures specific gravity and temperature, records the data, and sends it to a centralized hub. The device must meet safety standards and the physical limitations of the tank it is used for. Our solution to this was to build a hydrometer (using an ultrasonic and temperature sensor). The ultrasonic sensor will be used to calculate the specific gravity of the beer, while the temperature sensor will be used to find the temperature of the beer. The total cost for our design was $61.74. The important detail that one should keep in mind is to have the wires connected to the correct pins that are used in the code.

In short, our client wants a 3D tracking software that will be able to simulate a squash game or a training session to give some feedback or a sport analysis to improve athletes‚Äô performance.

Title: GNG1103-B3-Specific Gravity Measurement Device
Desc:
Beyond the Pale needs an accurate and sanitary method to measure, display and store the specific gravity, in a time-efficient and self-regulating process. 

Our group decided to tackle this project in a creative way. Utilizing our fluid dynamics knowledge, we were able to manipulate Bernoulli's equation and the continuity equation for an orifice plate flow meter in order to find the density & specific gravity. The sensors used were a differential pressure sensor and a volumetric flow meter sensor

Our cost for this project was 100$. 

Important details to consider with this design are the connectivity and proper sealing of all components to ensure a waterproof seal. Along with proper code for the sensors.

Title: VR Immersive Experience on Language Barriers basing on Unity
Desc:
The project is aimed at designing an immersive VR experience application to teach users how to deal with language barriers. 
The event is happening in a classroom when the students are trying to make a team for their project of a course. The user can choose to be a student who is not good at speaking English (person A) or be another group number. The user is allowed to use VR devices to move around and choose who to talk with and what to say. 
Based on the user's choice, there will be a good ending or a bad ending. For the good ending, person A will be able to show his value/advantages and stay in the group. For the bad ending, person A will be isolated and switched to another group.
The project is trying to guide the user to find a better way to handle language barrier problems and use these skills in real life.

Title: GNG1103-B2-Specific Gravity
Desc:
Beyond the Pale needs a food-safe device that can accurately measure brewing metrics and log specific gravity vs time in a cost-effective, automated system. 

Our team used the concept of fluid statics to accurately measure the S.G of fluids in a tank. We accomplished this using an Arduino with a couple of pressure sensors set at known heights. 3D Printing was utilized to print the casing for the electronics.

The budget goal of this project was to keep it under 1o0$.

Details to consider when trying to replicate this project would be to ensure your pressure sensors are accurate and that the correct pressures are being recorded.

Our design ideology while building it was focused on creating an affordable, and easy to build device with readily available materials so that our client can build and maintain it. 
Frisbee Bud is an extremely simple frisbee thrower that accomplishes the aforementioned goals. It is built with MDF sheets and uses an inexpensive fan motor to throw frisbees up to 15 feet away.

Title: H√¥tel abeilles - GNG1503 - Les √âco-√©tudiants
Desc:
1) √ânonc√© de probl√®me:
Le Bureau de D√©veloppement Durable de l‚ÄôUniversit√© d‚ÄôOttawa cherche une m√©thode pour promouvoir l'utilit√© continue des panneaux de signalisation en y int√©grant un √©l√©ment naturel, d'ici le 1er d√©cembre 2022. Il cherche √† d√©velopper un h√¥tel robuste, facile d‚Äôentretien et s√©curis√© contre le vol qui permettra de loger des pollinisateurs de fa√ßon s√©curitaire, tout en rendant le panneau plus accessible aux √©tudiants.

2) Solution:
Notre solution est un h√¥tel pour pollinisateur qui est fabriqu√© en utilisant du bois, des visses, de la colle, et du plastique. L'h√¥tel √† une toiture en composite plastique, et utilise des blocs en bois pour les trous o√π se nicheront les abeilles. Les inserts en bois ont des trous en demi-cercle qui permet √† la cr√©ation d‚Äôun trou entier lorsqu‚Äôils sont assembl√©s √† l‚Äôint√©rieur de l‚Äôh√¥tel. Ceci permet la facilit√© de nettoyage lors de l‚Äôentretien chaque saison. Les rainures √† l'int√©rieur de l'h√¥tel permettent de facilement ins√©rer les inserts en bois, et fonctionne aussi comme syst√®me pour √©viter le vandalisme et le vol des composantes. Ensuite, l‚Äôh√¥tel est attach√© aux panneaux de signalisation en utilisant une fente form√©e avec des 2x4 en bois. Les 2x4 en bois sont viss√©s √† une planche en bois qui sert comme support pour l‚Äôh√¥tel et la toiture. Finalement, une colle est utilis√©e pour assurer l'√©tanch√©it√© entre le panneau et le support, puis le support est viss√© √† la base de l‚Äôh√¥tel.

Title: GNG1103-GroupA01-Raft Cleaner
Desc: We have been tasked with designing a board cleaning system for Growcer. Growcer is a modular hydroponic farming organization that strives to be able to bring affordable and manageable crop farms to rural communities. A byproduct of growing the crops using their method, is algae that builds up on the growing boards. The algae build up ultimately attacks the roots of the plants being grown, and our design aims to consistently clean the growing boards while reducing the manual labour time spent on said task.

Title: GNG1103- A13 - GAS Team Hydroponic Raft Cleaner
Desc:
Problem Statement:
A simple to use, compact, automated cleaning device is needed for farmers in rural areas to effectively clean the rafts of their eco-friendly hydroponic gardens that will last many years.
Our Solution:
We have an area where the user can stack up to 8 boards on, we then have a wedge that splits the bottom board from the rest of the stack. The bottom board now gets pushed into two spinning wheels which grab onto the board and pull in towards our vertical spinning brush. This brush moves left, right, up and down to clean all holes of the raft. Later on there's larger brushes cleaning off the top and bottom of our raft, and light water to spray off excess residue. At the end we have an easy to carry bucket for the farmers to carry the cleaned boards anywhere.
Cost:
Total cost for all our prototypes was $72.38

Title: GNG2101-Z12-Step on it
Desc: Our Portable step (Step on it!) is a unique product as it achieves the needs of our clients which is portability and a step to use. A need for a portable step that could allow a person with difficulty reaching high stepping areas to use it in different places and ensure the safety of each user by making sure it can handle different surfaces as well as a variety of capacities. Our solution is using a scissor jack mechanism that has a minimum height of 3-inches and a maximum height of  16 inches. It is designed to be held or carried as a suitcase. The cost of this product is $299.99. The step also has a substep to help the users to use it. The first step is 2.8 inches long and the height from the first to the second step is exactly 3 inches. The platform is made of non-slippery material and surrounded by rubber tubing to prevent any injuries while stepping on it.

Title: Image Descriptor- Z14
Desc:
Team: Z14

Digital accessibility is slowly becoming more common however there are still many problems that a person with visual impairment faces every day. Some pictures that you might come across have alternative text which describes what is in the picture for people who can‚Äôt see for themselves however not all of them do. There are a few applications that exist which use AI to tell you about your surroundings by being able to take a picture of something around you. However that technology is rarely available for images or pictures that are already on a device. Your task is to create an application that could detect what is in an image when it does not have any alternative text. It should be easy to use and be able to say out loud the description (text to speech).

Title: GNG2101-Z24-Belt Buddies-Seat Belt Guide
Desc: The client is the father of a six-year-old girl who suffers from the condition arthrofibrosis. This condition affects all her joints, especially those in her limbs and extremities, causing her to experience limited mobility and flexion, and reduced strength. These constraints make it difficult for her to complete the everyday task of buckling a car seat belt on her own, as it is difficult for her to reach and use both arms to hold the seat belt components. The client has not attempted to produce his own solution due to a lack of materials, expertise, and equipment (3D printer, CNC laser cutter, etc). The product‚Äôs goal is to aid the girl in reaching for the male part of the seatbelt and guiding it to the secured/stationary female counterpart, to finally click them together to secure herself safely. The client has a budget of $50 for the product/solution.
tags: ['GNG2101/GNG2501', 'Health Sciences / Sciences de la sant√©', '3D Printer']

Title: GNG2101 - The Unattached Patient Z21
Desc:
The National Capital Region is approaching 100k or 10% of the population that cannot find a primary care physician. While there is a Provincial portal to add your name to the list, unfortunately, this results in extremely long wait times. At the end of it all, patients looking for doctors resort to google and search in expanding concentric circles from their home address in the hopes of finding doctors accepting new patients. To compound this problem, many doctors are approaching retirement age, with some accelerating their retirement due to the stresses of COVID. However, due to the complexity of some practice plans and the financial model in the province, the retiring doctors are finding it challenging to locate a doctor to take over their practice. This additional difficulty will only exacerbate the problem. 

Our task is to design a solution that allows more doctors to practice and see more patients through a combination of remote or telemedicine and new technologies. Economizing their cost structure by sharing infrastructures and applications will make their financial model more enticing and lead to changes within certain practice plans. This should then lead to changes in the system and more straightforward methods of finding a doctor and accepting new patients.

Title: GNG2101-Z25-The Jiffy App for Mental Health
Desc:
Many people in Ontario do not have access to mental health services, which may lead to dangerous situations if they cannot get the help that they need.

Our solution is an application that allows patients and doctors to meet for virtual consultations, which will provide interaction with doctors as well as attach great importance to everyone‚Äôs accessibility.

The application is free to use, but there will be consultation fees provided by the mental health professionals.

Title: Healthy Mind Connect- Z11
Desc:
During the COVID 19 pandemic, the World Health Organization (WHO) declared a new pandemic of mental health. Our goal is to develop a mobile app that can connect and facilitate virtual therapy sessions for those in need. Ontario as a whole is a very large province with lots of remote communities where it may be a day's drive to the nearest therapist. This app is designed to help these people connect with a therapist virtually to give them the help they need during this mental health pandemic. Note: The Bill of Materials is displayed in the economics report.

Furthermore, all project files including the final prototype can be found at the following link:
https://github.com/RaymondMoreau/Healthy-Mind-Connect

Pour ceux qui font la construction du prototype, il est sugg√©r√© de travailler en groupe de deux ou trois pour faciliter l'assemblage.

Title: The Shadow Pandemic
Desc: COVID-19 has dominated the world's agenda, and mandatory lockdowns were introduced in many countries to help control the spread of the virus. For many of us, the lockdown was inconvenient, but for others, the search for freedom was much more desperate. Measures such as lockdown and distancing rules, have led to an increase in domestic violence ‚Äì in particular intimate partner violence against women (VAW). Using multi-continental research collected by the United Nation surrounding violence against women, a narrative anchored by facts was quilted. To produce an artistic concept to palate our data, we chose to use two visual fashions; a world map website that easily encompasses the hard data we collected according to the country and a comic strip which explores the narratives of victims of VAW using statistics. By creating these two mediums, users are able to visualize the hard data in a familiar yet explorative manner and relate a compelling story that artistically highlights the shocking facts behind the story.

Title: GNG3100B-SDG12A-Fast Fashion and Waste
Desc:
Fast-fashion culture has accelerated production, resulting in exponentially increasing consumption & production of textile waste.

Using data and artistic visualization, we want to make our audience (Which is any and all who shop regularly) think about their consumption habits.

Title: AHL2100-GNG3100-DTI6304- SDG-13 Climate Action
Desc:
The project is a children's book with a story about a young boy in India and his actions to save the environment. The book also includes artistic visualizations on a deforested tree trunk and chimneys of a factory to show the loss of forests and increase in atmospheric pollution. The project was created for the STEAM Design course (DTI6304/AHL2100/GNG3100), which is an interdisciplinary design course that involves students from Digital Transformation and Innovation, Arts and Engineering. Our group worked on the Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) 13: Climate Action.

Our focus is to increase awareness and educate children about climate change and things that they can do to reduce the harsh impacts of mass deforestation for development. It is inspired from one of the sustainable development target which is to include climate change in the curriculum. 

The tool used for this visualization project is Procreate. The cost for the application is 10$. It also requires an iPad and apple pencil for the images drawn.

Avec ses trois diff√©rentes ouvertures, dont deux petites en haut pour les utilisateurs et une principale pour les travailleurs, on facilite la t√¢che de ces derniers en assurant une bonne organisation d‚Äôutilisation et on minimise le transfert microbien gr√¢ce aux poignets √©lev√©es ajout√©es sur chaque porte, ainsi c‚Äôest plus hygi√©nique. Cette poubelle est facile √† manipuler et r√©siste aux t√¢ches les plus difficiles vu qu‚Äôelle ne rend le syst√®me complet incluant la poubelle, ni beaucoup plus lourd, ni beaucoup plus large. Elle est aussi tr√®s facile et s√©curitaire √† utiliser vu qu‚Äôon a opte pour un syst√®me de verrouillage √† clic. Title: SDG12B - Fast Fashion Environmental Impact
Desc:
This project is an artistic data visualization exploring the shape of a tree to represent four main aspects of the environmental impact of the fast fashion industry. The project was created for the STEAM Design course (DTI6304/AHL2100/GNG3100), which is an interdisciplinary design course that involves students from Digital Transformation and Innovation, Arts and Engineering. Our group worked on the Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) 12: Responsible Consumption and Production.

The focus of our project is to expose the environmental impacts of fast fashion, showing how it contributes to microplastic pollution, CO2 emissions, wastewater, and textile waste. Our solution is to create an artistic visualization through a tree illustration. The message that our project is aiming for is to raise awareness on the impact of Fast Fashion and make people reflect on their consumption habits. 

The tool used for this visualization project is Adobe photoshop. The cost for the license is 20$/month. It would be a struggle to duplicate this prototype as we have a variety of datasets and the image is hand-drawn.

Title: 3D electroplating printer
Desc: Hydrogen bubble templating can create electrodes very suitable for water electrolysis and thus has major implications for a potential Hydrogen Economy. The current densities required to produce it and consequent heat generation make it impractical to plate large areas at once. These power issues can be mitigated by only plating a small area of the substrate at once. By mating an open source Arduino-powered potentiostat with  modular 3D printer, the electrochemical reaction needs to be localized with a total equipment cost below CAD $500. Challenges remain, in particular sufficiently containing the plating area, and as of yet there has not been an opportunity to test with nickel electroplating solution.

Title: GNG2101-C33-Innovative Solutions
Desc: Mr. Paul and Mrs. Clinton from the Tetra society, a company providing solutions for people with physical disabilities, need a device to hold a tablet on a wheelchair tray. Tablet use on a wheelchair for a person with a disability is often an inconvenient process as the tablet is loose on the wheelchair tray and cannot be secured anywhere while transportation. The tablet holder must be installed on the tray permanently, must move from a hidden position to an open position where the tablet is easily accessible for the wheelchair user. The tablet holding device also must be slim and trim. Our solution to this problem was to was to create a tablet holder that is attached to the bottom of the wheelchair tray. This holder is automated to go up and down and is powered by a battery. This movement is propelled by an actuator. The cost of production of our product was fairly low. We had to purchase a 9V battery and an actuator. The wheelchair tray was bought for us by the client. the biggest struggle that we had with creating our product was coming up with a way to automate it. Our original solutions were very complex and expensive. Our advice to anyone trying to attempt this project is to keep it as simple as possible.

Title: Pilier modulable pour utilisations multiples FB33

Notre solution apporte un atout aux municipalit√©s ainsi qu'aux particuliers, permettant une facilit√© de modulation accrue, pour diff√©rentes utilisations selon les besoins. 
Avec ses piliers combinables et sa taille moyenne, cette solution nous permet d'atteindre d'assez grandes hauteur ainsi que des hauteurs minimales lorsque voulues.

Title: GNG5140 Modular Ultralight eV Prototyping
Desc: The project is related to the structural body of eV (UO Supermiledge). The aim of the project is to remove the welding part between sections by designing a flexible joint. A high priority should be given to stress and property analysis during the designing stage of an object.
tags: ['Course-related Projects / Projets reli√©s a des cours', '3D Printer']

Title: GNG5140 - Sustainable Food Storage
Desc:
1. Problem statement: To investigate and improve an existing prototype for food storage in Eastern Canada: an above-ground vegetable root cellar designed by a local grassroots organization called Deep Roots Food Hub. 
  2. Our solution: An innovative storage solution is proposed to fully utilize the produce chamber space. Three customized plywood racks are dseigned to store produces, while coroplast boxes can be used to organize different vegetables and fruits. The solution also allows airflow to efficiently remove the heat produced by food.
  3. Cost: The plywood racks and coroplast boxes cost less than $1000 to make.
  4. Important details:
  • The chamber can store more than 17,500 kg of potatoes theoretically.
  • The stress test result reveals that the plywood structures can sustain 100,000 kg before cracking.
  • Racks are 6 ft tall, the top level can be accessed without using ladders. There are more than 5 ft of distance between racks to provide enough space for walking.
  • Wall Insulations, heating elements, and cooling elements were examined mathematically. The produce chamber can maintain a consistent temperature of 2-4 C in winter and early spring.
  • Green energy solutions, namely solar, wind, hydro, and geothermal, were investigated to help the root cellar stay off-grid.
  • Several UN Sustainable Development Goals are met, such as no poverty, zero hunger, good health and well being, responsible consumption and production, climate action, etc,

Title: GNG1103 D31 Heat Exchange Chamber
Desc:
Problem Statement:
"The current HVAC systems create a lot of greenhouse gasses which contribute to global warming and current GCHE systems take up too much space.‚Äú

Our Solution: 
As we believe that the main issue faced by GCHE systems is their large size we have designed a system that minimizes its footprint in terms of horizontal area. This is achieved by arranging the pipes in a vertical configuration and placing them below the HEC, going deeper instead of wider.

These vertical pipes would lead into a heat exchange chamber where the heat gained underground would be stored and exchanged with another set of air pipes looped around HEC that would deliver air to the house.

Cost:
$100 (For the prototype)

Challenges:
-Time constraints.
-Group member availability.

Important Details:
-The solar panel was not installed for the prototype.

Title: Amaas Return on investment

provide healthcare organizations with "End Use Products" at a commercial scale utilizing additive manufacturing. We are currently working with several biomedical engineering departments in hospitals across Canada to integrate our solution as a tool they can avail of for keeping legacy equipment alive and creating novel products for use.
create a return on investment tool regarding AMaaS solutions for End Use Health Care Products. The value metrics in this tool should not simply compare price differentials of MSRP, but show calculated time saved, appointments saved, equipment hours recouped, quantify simplification of procurement process, and better health outcomes. It should show clients their materials consumption, ecological footprint, and engagement levels. Along with how their individual metrics play into the community and ecosystem of organizations using healthcare 3D printing.

Title: GNG 2101 D15- PerDiem - Personal Safety App
Desc:
Our Client (Susan), is a retired nurse that lives alone. She was seeking out a solution that addressed the vulnerability experienced by people that live alone, as well as alleviates the stress on family members or friends that would have to regularly check on them.
She had some prioritised requirements which included:

  • A daily check in reminder that is easily customizable with respect to user preference.  After the user check in, the reminder resets for the same time in the next day.
  • A buffer period, as well as a dexterity test before a missed check-in is communicated to an emergency contact to avoid false emergencies.
  • Ability to store a list of 3 emergency contacts in order of prioritised communication.
  • An iOS based application that works on her iPad
  • Check in feature that can be paused on special cases such as when the user has company (friends or family) visiting for a period.

The Budget for this project was set at $50 CAD

Title: GNG1103-F32-Immersive Experience Tool
Desc:
The purpose of this project is to develop an immersive experience to educate a wide range of people on implicit bias towards minority groups and improve inclusivity by experiencing life through their eyes

Our solution consists of an expandable platform on Unity containing a template that future creators can follow. This template was based on the true story of Dayniah Manderson who was denied a teaching position because she uses a wheelchair. 

Cost: 0.00$

For optimal use, a Vuze 4k 180 degree stereoscopic camera is ideal for recording videos, but not necessary. Some basic video editing skills are needed as well.

Title: GNG1103-F31-Empathy-Through-VR
Desc: For years, experts in cognitive behaviour and psychologist have been developing techniques to teach empathy. To teach empathy, one must put themselves in other people‚Äôs shoes. Therefore, there is a need for a learning tool using virtual reality to enhance and foster empathy by allowing users to experience the lives of minority groups. As a solution, our team presented a real story utilizing the unique affordance of virtual reality (VR) that allows users to walk a virtual mile in the shoes of another. The VR experience is provided with different levels of interactivity with a different outcome, so the players are free to decide their moves. The cost of this project was 50$. The users will experience racism and respond to it appropriately. The main purpose of the project is to enhance empathy and raise the awareness of equity.

Title: GNG2101-C3p2-Power Grabber-EH
Desc:
Many people who are handicapped, quadraplegic, and elderly have difficulty picking up everyday items from the ground. It is important that those in need have access to a product that makes this task easier for them in order to improve their quality of life and give them more independence.


Those affected by these conditions are in need of a lightweight portable device allowing them to pick up small items off the floor and to place them where they can then be picked up with ease. This device functions with the use of minimal force or difficult movement, and is easily activated without the use of dexterity. 


The PowerGrab Mk1 offers the ease of use necessary for its users  combined with the strength and reliability to withstand time. Its lightweight materials and ability to distribute weight make it easy for users to pick up difficult items. This device requires little effort to control due to its E-Z press buttons, and no gripping force is required. Its long lasting battery ensures the reliability that is essential in ensuring the highest quality of time for its users.

Title: THEC Geothermal box with a dynamic resistor heating D23
Desc:
A THEC geothermal heating system is an underground heating solution for housing. It was primarily done in hotter climates and is really good at cooling but the heating is a major drawback to its current design. Due to this, the client wanted a solution that still had roots in using the THECs as the main air cooling system with the addition of a green heating system that won't consume a lot of power. The dynamic resistor heating system (DRHS) works by calculating the voltage needed to heat resistors to the desired temperature of the user. This is then sent to the TIP120 transistor which then adjusts the voltage running in the resistors and adjusts the overall heating. There are many backups and safes if something were to go wrong which can be seen in the uploaded code below. Also, a calculator was developed to see the number of resistors needed and that respective file is linked below under project files.
To View Design Day Presentation: Design Day Pitch - Google Slides

**SPECIAL NOTE ABOUT BOM**
This BOM was made specifically to outline all of the components used, a lot of the circuitry material was already in the possession of our members. Due to this if replication of this project is wanted. Please be more accountable for your spending and use of tools.

Title: GNG 1103 - THEC Geotherrmal Heating system D22
Desc:
The heat Exchange Chamber (THEC) is a geothermal system to replace current heating and cooling systems in houses; however, it is currently unable to provide sufficient heating in winter to heat homes to a comfortable range. The system also needs to be renewable, not contribute to the production of emissions, and low energy. Our design builds on the client‚Äôs patent with renewable solar energy to provide the electrical and thermal needs of our system. Our system captures thermal energy in water and stores it in a hot water tank we call the thermal battery. The thermal battery is to improve the reliability of our system in situations with a lack of sunlight, such as at night or on cloudy days. The water of our system is circulated by pumps running off solar panels. We also plan to implement thermoelectric plates to increase the efficiency of our system by converting lost thermal energy into electrical energy to power the pumps. These plates would be installed on the solar panels and thermal battery to capture lost or excess heat. Our addition supplies additional heating in winter to allow the system to heat to room temperature.

Title: GNG2101 - LightSupport - human powered light C11
Desc: This repository describes a system that takes mechanical energy generated by a human and produces light energy for the purpose of growing plants. Humans were chosen as the ideal power source because they do not generate emissions, they are feasible on a small scale and they do not require heavy resources to create (like solar panels). In addition to being sustainable, this system is designed for users with hypermobility in mind.

Title: The Last End-Effector
Desc:
Inverse Kinematics: Analytical Inverse Kinematics solution coded in Python using triangular plane projection. Senses whether the coordinate input is in range of the arm. Average algorithm runtime of 1/100th of a millisecond, near-instant execution. Scalable to higher degrees of freedom without sacrificing time or space complexity.

User Interface: Built in Python using TKinter Library. Takes user input for desired end-effector coordinate. Checkboxes for attachment control. Emergency stop button. User feedback for emergency stop and out-of-range coordinates.

Attachment and Motor Control: Built in Python using PyMata's Firmata protocol for communication with host computer. Relays GUI data to Arduino Microcontroller and controls steppers and attachments using analog PWN ports.

End-Effector: Completely modular system with removable attachments. Current working attachments include a water blaster, vacuum, LED light, and drawing tool. The system allows for others to be developed and easily added based on needs.

Safety Features: Software and Hardware emergency stop using high visibility buttons. Instant deactivation time, killing power to all motors and attachments. Seamlessly resume activity afterward. GUI proves step by step process for dealing with first-aid emergencies after the button is pressed.

Title: C-11
Desc:
Code: Done in C++ to test every possible solution of our (x,y,z) coordinates. These coordinates were solved in our inverse kinematics calculations.

User Interface: The code allows us to control the arm with the use of a keyboard. The end-effector is controlled by pressing the letter d on your keyboard to open and close the claws.

Safety: Sweep of servo motor code opens the claws continuously which is impractical and unsafe. The code used implements the feature of controlling the opening of the claws by pressing a button, so the claws only move when you tell them to.

Inverse kinematics: We used a mathematical approach of matrices to solve for the (x,y,z) coordinates in symbolab. A diagram was drawn to find out where the theta, alpha, and lengths were on the z and x-axis. These values were put into a table. The values were then put into 3 matrices, one for each joint. Then we multiplied the 3 matrices in symbolab to get the (x,y,z) coordinates that were then put into our code to test every possible solution.

Sources for code: Pankaj Kumar Rathi posted code in teams for the robotic arm code, and with the help of our PM Luis Perez Acosta, we could write code that includes our inverse kinematics and parts of Pankaj's code.
The sweep of the servo motor code is from: https://forum.arduino.cc/t/how-to-make-a-servo-sweep-once-back-and-forth-with-the-same-keyboard-key/526048/2
The idea of the gear claw is from: https://www.robotshop.com/ca/en/ez-robot-servo-gripper.html?gclid=Cj0KCQjw_4-SBhCgARIsAAlegrXumRhnhQR0n-0q-R0emKYAh9htyXiL9M0hjNlHjcqI8biGVIXpHMAaAkHDEALw_wcB

Title: GNG1103-C1-Group 3-ARMageddon
Desc:
We have developed various codes that allow a robotic arm to function with end-effectors and a user interface.

The video above is a feature of our design day presentation, where our user, Sam, shows how easy it is to use our solution. It features basic robot movement, Sam's interaction with the graphical user interface, an exemplary interaction with the camera and corrosion detection software, and a demo of the PIR sensors.

Our user Sam is fresh out of high school with little technical experience and decides to join the Royal Canadian Navy. Aboard the Halifax class destroyer, Sam is put to work removing the rust off the walls using sandblasters, vacuums and paint sprayers, a tedious and time-consuming task that our inverse kinematic solution solves. 

Our client requested an automated way to paint and remove corrosion from the walls. Our team of first-year engineers went above and beyond to implement corrosion detection software working alongside an OV7670 Arduino compatible camera. Our solution is ready from start to finish.

As a proof of concept of the client's need to water blast and paint corroded areas, our marker end-effector facilities this by drawing shapes using preset input coordinates. 

The solution is entirely automized with our graphical user interface featuring buttons directing to the Arduino libraries and camera interface.

For the safety of Sam and other crew members aboard, our PIR sensors looped with the Arduino interrupt function triggers the LED and buzzer to alert the crew member of the movement of the robot.

This project proved a big challenge for our team of first-year engineers. With tons of googling and time spent asking our TA for coding help, we are proud to present our finished solution to you!

Links to Github pages
https://github.com/becapoulin/inverse-kinematics
https://github.com/benoittremblayy/Corrosion-Detection-AI
https://github.com/jessbeardshaw/OV7670Camera-with-PIRsensors

Title: GNG1103 D1 1 The Heat Exchange Chamber
Desc:
Group name: The Pelicans (D 1.1)

Problem statement:
Our client, on behalf of their customers, needs a low-tech, zero-emission, and inexpensive heat exchange chamber. The current GCHE needs to be modified to be more compact, have a sustainable power source, and be able to achieve higher temperatures in the winter, all in the scope of an average townhouse. Furthermore, our client needs us to improve upon the current design such that the system can warm air to 20 degrees centigrade in the winter time.

The cost to replicate this design should not exceed 100$, however an issue our team struggled with while creating this system was that several of our electrical components could only be bought in bulk or in large quantities (Packs of 10,5 etc)

https://vimeo.com/701512002

Title: GNG2101-C2p3-Image Descriptor
Desc: The context of this project is based on a client who has visual impairment and who is not satisfied with the available solutions on the market to help them read text out loud. This has led to the development of a mobile application unlike any other in the market, that would meet the client‚Äôs most critical requirements. The application will allow users to select between PDF and TXT files, between PNG and JPEG images and to take a picture, and the extracted text is then converted to speech. A convenient reading speed was chosen to meet the client's desired reading rate and high contrast colors were chosen to ensure a high level of accessibility. Finally, the app is very user-friendly with a minimum number of clicks to convert text to speech.

Title: GNG1103 Team Pandora D21 THEC
Desc:
Group: Team Pandora (D2.1)

Project Background: Our client, Mr.  Enendu, holds a patent (Canadian patent 2626472) for a Thermal Heat Exchange Chamber (THEC) which is a low-tech zero emission HVAC (heating, ventilation, and air conditioning) innovation that extracts energy from the ground into buildings to achieve required thermal comfort using no fossil fuel, refrigerant, or heat pump. We have been requested to build-upon and prototype the system.

Project Statement: Our goal is to improve upon the design by increasing the output temperature during the winter in North America while maintaining the project's initial goal of creating a sustainable and low-cost product.

Solution: We have broken down the prototype into three main sub-systems:
  1. The Heat Exchange Chamber (HEC): Composed of concrete and clay, and filled with water. Inside the HEC will be six high density polyethylene (HDPE) pipes that are connected to our piping network outside of the HEC.
  2. The Piping Network: Six looped piped composed of (HDPE). The looped configuration was chosen to increase the surface area which will promote heat transfer.
  3. The Control System: The control system is a negative feedback cycle that ensures that the desired temperature is maintained by adjusting the fan power as a result of the measured output temperature.

Prototypes and Results:
  • Prototype 1: The HEC and piping network were tested to ensure that the system can reach the client's desired temperature. Results of simulated tests and calculations demonstrated that the prototype is a success.
  • Prototype 2: The control system was tested and our simulation successfully adjusted the fan speed to match the desired output temperature.
  • Prototype 3: Prototype 1 and 2 are combined to see if the entire system is fully functional and if we successfully created a proof of concept for the client. The physical build was a success as the outlet temperature increased however we encountered issues while combining the code and circuit.

Cost: The total cost of the prototype is $175.

Important Details: 
  • The sump pump was excluded from the final prototype design as it would have increased our budget for minimal results.
  • CAD drawings (onshape), circuits (tinkercad) and code can be found in the user manual document.

Title: Mobilier urbain - √âquipe FB11 - GNG1503
Desc:
Ceci est un projet dans le cadre du cours GNG 1503 ‚Äì G√©nie de la conception, qui a pour but de nous apprendre le processus de conception et de mettre nos nouvelles connaissances en pratique, tout en n√©cessitant notre cr√©ativit√© et un travail en groupe. Pour ce projet, nous allons faire la conception d‚Äôun mobilier urbain qui sera modulaire et servira √† plus qu‚Äôune utilisation. Ceci sera con√ßu pour l‚Äôentreprise Northex et on utilisera leur b√©ton fait √† partir de mat√©riaux contamin√©s recycl√©s. 

Probl√®me :
Il est essentiel de concevoir un mobilier urbain pour Northex, qui sert √† plusieurs utilisations et en m√™me temps est s√©curitaire, simple √† utiliser et innovant. L‚Äôaccessibilit√©, l‚Äôoriginalit√© et le co√ªt sont des aspects √† consid√©rer, en plus du fait qu‚Äôil sera modulaire et simple √† fabriquer. Ce produit ira sur le march√© pour √™tre utilis√© par le public, donc il est n√©cessaire qu‚Äôil soit profitable et attrayant. 

Solution :
La solution que nous avons offert est un mobilier urbain compos√© d'un planteur entour√© de bancs et tables. Nous avonc con√ßu un seul morceau en forme de "c" qui se r√©p√®te plusieurs fois afin de composer le mobilier urbain.

Title: GNG 2101 - Group C2 1 The Extendables - Collapsible Storage Rack
Desc:
The uOttawa Free store is looking for a collapsible clothing rack that is both easily mobile and cost effective, with high clothing capacity and moderate weight bearing ability while remaining accessible and easy to set up.

The solution group 2.1 came up with is a design for a clothing rack made up of two individual pieces. The first piece is the base which contains wheels at the bottom for movement. The second piece is the frame which can be inserted into the base for an upright clothing rack. The frame also contains a rotating clothing hanging rod on both sides which can be extended and adjusted in height via a groove and fit mechanism, as can be seen in the initial design image attached to this project . Since the whole clothing rack is made up of two individual pieces that can be fit into one another, the clothing rack can also be collapsed to take up less space when not in use, but is still simple to set up for volunteers of the Free store.

The cost of the first prototype is estimated to be  $94.75 solely for materials costs, including wheels, wood, PVC pipes, etc.

Please note that the initial design attached as an image to this project was slightly modified to accommodate physical limitations experienced during the designing process. The final prototype and subsequent deliverables will further explain the changes made in detail, which should be noted if the design is to be duplicated.

Please also note that a video explaining the final prototype is included in the project files.

Desc:
This project was a design challenge proposed by Ross Video, in collaboration with OSEG, to develop a panel that could be used in the TD Place arena for Ottawa 67‚Äôs hockey games. Ross Video needs a user-friendly interface in order to quickly control the output of information during hockey games.

Our design incorporates 5 aspects of the fan experience into one system. It also automates the input of information by retrieving data from the OHL website through a JSON file in order to save time for the user and prevent errors. 

Our project cost was $0 since we use the free Dashboard software. An important thing to note is that when the project is split into different files before being combined into the final product, it is important to make sure the parameters are implemented properly in the final product, otherwise certain features will not work.

Title: GNG1503D-FD9-Identification de Roulements
Desc:
Il y a beaucoup de personnes qui viennent au magasin de GBS ou envoient des photos de roulements pour avoir de l'aide pour les identifier. Parfois ils sont intacts mais ils sont aussi parfois bris√©s. C'est un processus qui prend du temps pour les employ√©s de GBS et qui n'est pas tr√®s efficace. Votre t√¢che est de cr√©er un syst√®me capable d'identifier des roulements SKF du catalogue ci-dessous tout seul ou est capable de guider un utilisateur vers le bon item. Le syst√®me devrait √™tre bilingue et √™tre modulaire pour qu'un autre type de roulement puisse y √™tre
ajout√© plus tard.

La solution que nous avons trouv√© consiste d'un montage pour prise de photo, un interface d√©velopper avec Anvil Works, un programme pour la d√©tection des contours et le calculs des mesures dans Google Colab et une base de donn√©es cr√©√©e dans Google Sheets qui est modulaire comportant plus de 400 diff√©rents roulements. La pr√©cision des mesures varie entre 0.1 et 0.5 mm et le montage permet la prise de photo de roulement de 5mm √† 250mm.

Le co√ªt total de notre projet est de 49$.

La cam√©ra utilis√©e est importante dans la prise de photo et nous avons trouv√© qu'un module de cam√©ra √† 15$ fonctionnait, mais que les cam√©ras des t√©l√©phones intelligents r√©cents √©tait les plus optimales.

Title: No More Babies Stuck in Hot Cars - GNG1103 B01 Team 1
Desc:
SafeBaby is the perfect device for busy parents who live in areas where the temperature can rapidly increase to fatal levels.

We understand that parents have a lot on their minds and that it can be easy to forget a child in a car. This affordable device is easy to install and has 2 sensors, a motion detector and a thermal detector, which are able to detect a child's presence in a hot car and send a notification to the parent when concerning levels have been detected. 

Our device is an enclosed 15cm x 12cm x 4cm box that contains an ESP8266 chip, 2 thermistors, 1 PIR sensor, a battery source and a bunch of wires. 

During our design process, we made 3 prototypes, tested them rigorously and implemented numerous changes based on those tests to ensure that our final device was up to our standards as well as our client's.

Title: Library Wayfinding Service A16
Desc:
Clients with disabilities are having issues navigating the Morisset Library, with help from
bluetooth beacons we can guide them to major areas in the library using an accessible mobile web application. The web application is hosted for free here, by netlify.com. Each bluetooth beacon costed us about $33 CAD with shipping and taxes included. We were unable to get much work with connecting the beacons to the site itself; an app (using Android Studio, for example) might be a better course of action. Combining the two concepts together could be an even better idea: have a simple and accessible site describe the application and how it works, while also providing a direct download link of the app.

Title: GNG2101-Microwave Transfer Device-A20
Desc:
Project background / Contexte du projet

Moving or lifting objects from the counter into and out of the microwave may be difficult for people with limited mobility. This problem may make their daily lives more challenging and cause them to lose their independence. Our goal is to create a device that can transport a variety of items safely and without causing damage. The device is designed for general use and may be easily assembled by individuals so that it can be moved securely from one place to another.

The client required a device that allows ease of use for a touch sensitive control panel without visual elements. The product is a grid template with door panels attached via hinges for each button. Title: Tic Intel - Group B13
Desc:
Tic Intel is a Canadian-based company that provides the most innovative physical tic protection glove to people who experience injuries from physical tics in their everyday life. 

Our product is designed to minimize injuries caused by physical tics while maximizing comfort and dexterity for everyday use. Using cutting-edge technology, the glove is able to accomplish this through optimized padding placement and the utilization of impact foam which allows for the glove to effectively dissipate kinetic energy during an impact. 

The dark color and slim design of the gloves enable its fashionable appearance and avoid the "hospital" look of common solutions from competing brands. 

This glove is also durable against cuts, heat and is meant to be worn for prolonged periods of time to truly suit your everyday needs.

If you are experiencing physical tics, you have the right to a solution that makes you happy. 

Chose happiness today with Tic Intel.

Title: GNG1503D - MAP Conception - Identification de Roulement
Desc:
Au sein de l'entreprise GBS, il y a un r√©el probl√®me quant √† l'identification des roulements pr√©sent√© par leurs clients. De plus, les employ√©es les plus experts sont attraient √† prendre leurs retraitent et les nouveaux sont malheureusement inexp√©riment√© ce qui constitue un probl√®me majeur pour le chiffre d‚Äôaffaires de l‚Äôentreprise.


Suite √† la sollicitation du directeur de l‚Äôentreprise, monsieur Mitch Bouchard, nous avons d√©velopp√© un syst√®me capable de faire la mesure et l‚Äôidentification des roulements de fa√ßon automatique. Il s‚Äôagit de Roul‚ÄôScan. Ce syst√®me est constitu√© d‚Äôun scanner physique qui comporte une cam√©ra mobile qui va scanner le roulement pos√© sur la plaque acrylique pr√©alablement √©clair√©e. Title: Unified Points System Proj5

Our Problem Statement:
Current loyalty reward programs tend to exist in big-name companies far more than smaller businesses. With our product, Zafin can democratize loyalty points and increase accessibility to reward programs even further.

Title: Fall 2021 A5 Computer Scientists
Desc: A detachable snow plow for a wheelchair. This one features an electric power shovel as the "snow plow" part.

Title: Guide2Go A1
Desc: Our group has developed a guiding cane, allowing a visually impaired user to be guided by a sighted acquaintance, while remaining socially distanced by up to six feet. The cane extends and collapses to various lengths, and features a haptic feedback navigation system to direct the two users. There also exists an interchangeable end on the cane, allowing the blind person to switch between a handle and a typical white cane tip, depending on their need.

Title: A2 DJSW

Title: Peak Productivity - A3
Desc:
Peak Productivity is an app development team that developed a productivity planner designed to monitor a user's school productivity through analyzing their daily events, and planning additional events accordingly. As a React Native application, the user is able to view their events through 3 different lenses: Monthly, Weekly and Daily. Consequently, upon adding a new color-coded event, it is automatically added to the appropriate area in the planner along with study and review sessions. 

GitHub repo: https://github.com/patfire12345/prod_planner

Title: Proj 16 OLP loyalty rewards program
Desc:
Loyalty programs offered by financial institutions and other businesses are fairly limited in how consumers can spend their accumulated points. We have used this as an opportunity to create a system embedded in a website that integrates with other loyalty programs so that consumers need not worry about such limitations any longer.

Features :
- Our tier upgrade system allows users to take advantage of their points gaining and spending by adding in a monthly fee for extra perks and rewards.

- Easily exchange points from your gained OLP points to other loyalty programs such as PC optimum.

- Our easy-to-use User interface makes all important information easy to find and very accessible.

Title: Group 17 - Wallet XVII
Desc:
Wallet XVII is a SaaS platform with the main goal of democratizing loyalty points. This is achieved by giving Ecosystem Partners (EPs) a platform to share their exclusive rewards points with a large pool of users. Users are then allowed to exchange points between EPs, Redeem points for goods, services, and cash, and send points to other users. The platform serves Banks as the main client, and revenue is generated by charging users per transaction, and generating ad revenue.

The goal of our project is to create a lightweight breathable glove that includes padding for the knuckles to prevent dislocation and burn/cut resistant material for the palm. Title: Honeycomb
Desc:
Problem Statement
Children in locked cars, especially in extreme temperatures, are in immediate danger if left alone. A product is needed to help these children by either removing them from the car or regulating the temperature in the car. The product must also be easily installable and easy to use, can be integrated directly into any vehicle, and prompts a fast response time from the user.

Solution
Our solution, Honeycomb, addresses the client's concerns and given design criteria. It is made up of a fan, sensors, an Arduino UNO, and a battery pack. It will sense when a child is in the vehicle and the temperature is above 30 degrees Celsius, then activate a cooling system that will regulate the temperature until it is manually reset and the child is safe.
 
Important Details
When duplicating Honeycomb, one may face the difficulty of generating similar code that assimilates the varying subsystems within our solution. Additionally, the assembly of the solution may face manufacturing errors as the system contains several wires and small parts. There were also difficulties procuring hardware as some of it was fragile and took time being delivered.

Title: GNG1103-G12-FanEngagement
Desc:
Problem Statement:Ross Video needs a new way to engage fans throughout games, but especially when the players aren‚Äôt playing. They need to be able to change and adjust statistics very quickly, as well as have an easy-to-use interface to ensure timely updates from the operator and time limits to show certain information.

Our Solution: We will be creating a system that allows fans to have the ability to vote on what team they think will win. This is in attempt to increase fan engagement. We will also be creating a new team set up system that is automatic, and engaging to all fan types. 

Cost: Although no direct cost, Ross Video will have the option to increase cost in order to increase value.

Important Details: Since it is possible through a complex code, this will be difficult to duplicate. Although once achieved it is easy to run and reliable.

Title: Projet ClearView √âquipe FA13
Desc:
Daniel Deschamps repr√©sentant la Section de l‚Äôidentit√© judiciaire du Service de Police d‚ÄôOttawa a besoin d‚Äôun dispositif capable d‚Äôajuster  la distance entre la cam√©ra et la surface ainsi que l‚Äôintensit√© lumineuse du flash, afin de permettre de prendre du premier coup la meilleure photo possible, avec le bon focus, pour une photo extr√™mement nette. Nous avons donc con√ßu un dispositif compos√© d'un flash circulaire auquel sont attach√© trois pi√®ces cr√©√©es avec une imprimante 3D qui retiennent trois tiges r√©tractables en acier inoxydable. Toutes les parties sont fix√©es avec de la colle √©poxy. Les tiges sont fix√©es √† un angle de 12,5 degr√©s par rapport au flash pour qu'elles ne soient pas visible dans les photos prisent par l'appareil. La distance entre la cam√©ra et la surface peut √™tre vari√©e entre 5cm et 42cm. Le co√ªt total des mat√©riaux est de 92,74$. Le flash poss√®de huit adaptateurs lui permettant de s'attacher √† des lentilles d'un diam√®tre de 49mm, 52mm, 55mm, 58mm, 62mm, 67mm, 72mm et 77mm. Il poss√®de aussi quatre diffuseurs de lumi√®re permettant de changer la couleur de la lumi√®re √©mise entre le orange, le bleu, le blanc huitre et le transparent. Le flash √† plusieurs intensit√©s lumineuses diff√©rentes. Il faut moins de cinq minutes pour installer le dispositif sur la cam√©ra et pour l'ajuster afin que la distance entre la cam√©ra et la surface soit id√©al.

Title: GNG1103 - GroupB 19 - Child Environment Alert System
Desc: There is a ridiculous quantity of child deaths that occur due to heatstroke in a vehicle per year,  on average there are 38 deaths per year (NSC). Our group has been tasked to created a product that will detect when a child is present in a vehicle while parked and also notify the surrounding persons and guardians to the situation. Our approach to this issue was a modular system consisting of a Driver Detection Pad, Seatbelt Switch (detecting a child), Sensor Module, Fan, Arduino Housing, and alert system (LED strip, Buzzer, Application). These systems are incorporated into the vehicle to create a reliable and efficient system to detect  a child trapped in a vehicle, and notify the guardians and passerby's. Through tireless effort and hours of dedication, this product has reached an ideal outcome and has become a quality product.

Title: B-16 - SAVE
Desc:
By Shahd, Aviral, Vishnu, Elijah
Our product consists of three main sensors, air quality sensor, a temperature sensor, and a PIR sensor. A speaker is connected that will be activated whenever the temperature or CO2 levels are at a dangerous level. Additionally, if these dangerous levels are detected the motion sensor will start working and send alerts through the speaker.

Title: B20 Elite4 Car Sensor
Desc: The Elite4 Car Sensor aims at rescuing children or pets left alone inside a personal vehicle; it is equipped with various sensors‚Äîto detect the child or pet's presence and the car's internal conditions‚Äîand two distinct alert systems, working via Wi-Fi, which can warn caregivers, their family or friends and passersby.

Title: Zafin Ecosystem A11
Desc:
Zafin is a banking software company with clients that include banks like TD and CIBC. Zafin tasked our class with creating a new loyalty rewards program. They want a product that they can sell to their clients, and be done with it. They want to be "hands-off" as soon as the client buys the product.

Our product, the Zafin Ecosystem, is a way to connect the loyalty rewards program of every business and bank that wants to join. The Zafin Ecosystem allows banks to establish an exchange rate between their point system and another. This way, anyone earning points with one rewards program isn't confined to the rewards of just that loyalty software.

Link to Z-Ecosystem prototype:
Zaffin Prototype (bubbleapps.io)

Title: Stars - GNG1103 Proj13
Desc:
When our team met with Zafin at the beginning of the semester, they expressed that they were looking for a platform which offers their clients and users a seamless experience, giving them the technology to achieve more.  They were set on including smaller partners, and taking a more horizontal approach at the existing loyalty rewards system, allowing more freedom for the users.

With the use of PowerApps, our team decided to create a platform that allows clients and users to do just that.  Our app, which we have named Stars! has found a way to allow smaller businesses to participate by offering a pricing plan based on the size of their business, as well as a points value based on the kinds of goods and services they offer.  

Stars! Also allows users to convert points from business A to business B, through an algorithm that takes into account the dollar value of the points of each business.

Title: Hot Car Emergency- B14-Save the backseat
Desc:
The device designed by our team for our client has one major outcome: notifying the parent(s)/guardian/passerby that a child/ animal is stuck inside of the car. The purpose of the device is for that person that is notified to be able to go as quick as possible and get the child out of the vehicle in extreme conditions(temperature and kids stuck in the car). 
  The presence of a child/pet in the backseat is detected by a motion and temperature sensor. When the threshold temperature(30 degrees celsius) is reached motion will be introduced in order to test if the alarm system will trigger.
  A need for parents/guardians to detect/get notified by a device that is affordable, easy to install and not attached to the car. So that the parent/guardian can get their children/animal out of their car when they are stuck inside of it.

Title: Douze - Group 12
Desc:
Some hot summer days, or parts of the world that have intense and often extreme temperatures can and has been the culprit of numerous deaths and injuries related to heatstroke and suffocation.

Our device is designed to eliminate that risk and give parents peace of mind. Douze's hot car detection device.

With this compact device, your child will be safe from extreme temperatures, reminding the parent that their child or pet is present. A combination of the device's motor sweep sensor and a mobile application will make sure that your child or pet is accounted for.

Title: Aide √† la Photographie pr√©sent√© par IngeniumX
Desc:
Imaginez un policier arrive sur une sc√®ne de crime, il utilise ses deux mains afin de manier la cam√©ra et le flash, la lumi√®re naturelle est faible et il a de la difficult√© √† trouver un angle et une distance convenable menant √† une bonne photo. 

L'√©quipe IngeniumX a r√©solu ce probl√®me avec un tout nouveau prototype qui r√©pond √† tous ces besoins et facilite le travail du photographe sur la sc√®ne de crime.

Le prototype:
- Garde un angle perpendiculaire de la cam√©ra par rapport √† la surface.
- Illumine clairement la surface avec une lumi√®re ajustable attach√©e √† la cam√©ra.
- S'attache facilement et solidement aux lentilles.
- Garde une distance d√©sir√©e de la lentille par rapport √† la surface.
- Tout cela en gardant les deux mains sur la cam√©ra!

Sp√©cifications du dispositif:
- Poids: 500g
- Dimensions d√©ploy√©e: 34 x 34 x 17 - 27 cm
- Dimensions de rangement: 34 x 34 x 5 cm
- Compatibilit√©: lentilles 67 et 77 mm

Sp√©cifications de la lumi√®re:
- Poids: 300g
- Vie de batterie: 4 heures
- Luminosit√©: 500 lumens
- Dimensions: 13.97 x 6.03 x 55.88 cm
- Vis d'attache 1/4''
- Piles: 3 x AA

Vid√©o 360¬∞ du prototype: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_XRZ2ev77RQ

Title: GNG2101-A15-Safety Squad
Desc: The client is in need of a simple personal safety application compatible with iOS that has fundamental functionalities, such as daily reminders, check-ins, customizable timers, and message alerts capable of being sent to the user‚Äôs contacts in cases of emergencies. The team is thus coding a mobile application that consists of these features to ensure the user's safety. There has been no major cost to produce this project as the development softwares used by the team members are free; however, there is an additional cost to make a SMS messaging system of 6 cents per message. When duplicating this design, it may be difficult to do so without an iOS device. The client requested an iOS application; thus, to code an iOS application, one member should have a compatible device. The code can be found in the project files; however, the designer must copy and paste those files in a flutter project in order to work.

La cam√©ra pourra mesurer les dimensions int√©rieures et ext√©rieures du roulement tandis-que les autres caract√©ristiques du roulement pourront √™tre inscrites manuellement par l'utilisateur.

Afin de bien identifier les dimensions du roulement √† l'aide d'appareil photo, le roulement devra se situer dans dans le 3/4 inf√©rieur de la photo, tandis-que l'objet servant d'√©chelle, telle qu'une pi√®ce de 5¬¢, devra se trouver dans le 1/4 sup√©rieur de la photo.

Title: Polaris - GNG2101 - B33 - Library Wayfinding Application
Desc: This application is designed for the University of Ottawa Morisset library, providing live path navigation through both visual and auditory feedback. Title: THE HAZARDS - Guiding Cane B32
Desc:
About This Project
  • Due to the ongoing Covid-19 pandemic, visually impaired individuals are not able to safely receive the navigation aid they could previously have due to social distancing regulations. Before the pandemic, individuals would be able to link arms with a navigator allowing them to travel safely in difficult-to-navigate spaces (grocery store, outdoor trails). This created a need for a companion guiding cane that allows users to receive navigation aid while still maintaining social distancing.

Problem Statement
  • The client requires an intuitive, compact, and portable guiding cane which allows visually impaired individuals to receive navigation aid from others that ensures the user is able to oblige by social distancing restrictions implemented due to COVID-19.

Title: Annota Mobile - Mobile Note Transcription - Team Z6
Desc:
Our client requires a mobile application capable of digitizing and organizing a variety of handwritten notes for both research purposes and day-to-day life. This application enables the user to transcribe any form of text by taking a picture of it. The transcription is then saved and organized into specific categories which enables the user to search their past transcriptions in a variety of ways (by date, text content, user comments, categories, etc.). Furthermore, the application includes a to-do style list which can notify the user of pending tasks based on both time and their location. 
The only cost associated with this project is Google's API usage fee which depends on the numbers of requests generated by the application.

Title: GNG2101-Z2--MakerMove
Desc:
In order to help further relieve and understand the user‚Äôs Hypermobility Spectrum Disorder (HSD), our mobile application periodically notifies, recommends exercises, and provides a system to track their pain over time.

We have used Android Studio and Java. Take a look at our GitHub Repository for all our application/code progress, work, changes, and history: 
[ https://github.com/Marco-Cen/Movement-Reminder ]

The current state of our android application remains free, but may be subject to additional fees with further usage if the database is extended to the cloud and synced up; we are using the service of MongoDB for our database, specifically MongoDB Realm. Currently, the database is local and specifically stored on that device/emulator being used to run the application. With MongoDB Realm, if the database is extended to cloud-sync, other services of MongoDB could be used such as the data visualization tool MongoDB Charts; cloud syncing the database to MongoDB Realm in the cloud has the pay model of pay as you need. (There is a free limit of resources that refreshes monthly provided to users each month)

[Note: This is a proof of concept where data is retained in a database. Our application mainly simplifies the process of collecting data from the user, where additional features are merely additional]

Title: GNG2102 - Z5 - Medication Dispenser
Desc:
For our project we used the iterative engineering design process. We also used effective tools learned in class such as elements of the design thinking model. 

          Our client has ADHD and is required to take medication on a daily basis. This task proves challenging to her because of the symptoms of her learning disability (her memory). Through our client meetings, we were able to better understand our clients needs. With this information we were able to develop the following problem statement: 

          Design, for those who have memory retention, and attention difficulties, a smart pill case that eases the pill taking process by 
             a.    organizing the medication, and
             b.    giving reminders
all while being economically advantageous to similar products on the market.

To complete this project you will need:
   -   6X AAA batteries and a holder for the batteries
   -   28BYJ-48 stepper motor
   -   IR LED and Receiver
   -   2X LED lights (yellow and red)
   -   Pololu A-star 328 pb
   -   Laser cutter (+ cutting materials)
   -   3D printer (+ Filament)
   -    A button
   -    2X 100 Ohm resistor
   -    180 Ohm resistor
   -  1/8" MDF board

Title: Automatic Slide Transcriber - GNG2101 - D01 - D4
Desc:
The client finds that they are spending too much time on note taking. Since the notes are always unrecognized to be copied, they are in need of a software that can convert their notes into a simple text format in a reasonable amount of time. 


The following concept is at a high-level, what we initially plan to prototype for the client. It will allow the client to perform the following features:

  • Import Class Notes into the application to be transcribed, and


  • Select a target directory to be used for saving files


In an effort to make the application easy for the customer to use, the amount of setup required by the user will be minimal and it will have very specific choices for the user in the graphical user interface. It‚Äôs majority of its functionality is abstracted away from the user so they will need to know specifics about the application, only what to ‚Äúinput‚Äù and what to expect as ‚Äúoutput‚Äù

Title: GNG1503-FB04-CAAE
Desc:
Due aux difficult√©s des m√©thodes courantes (mauvais r√©sultats, requi√®rent trop de ressources, etc.), notre client Daniel Deschamps nous a demand√© de concevoir un prototype pour les mesures d'angle d‚Äôentr√©e d'un projectile sur une surface robuste de fa√ßon rapide, pr√©cise, exacte et abordable pour les policiers et d√©tectives.

Pendant la phase de l‚Äôempathie, nous avons r√©colt√© des besoins du client en utilisant la mentalit√© du d√©butant, et les avons interpr√©t√©s sous forme de crit√®res de conception pour ensuite former l'√©nonc√© du probl√®me . Suivant ceci, nous avons effectu√© des remues m√©ninges tout en ne portant aucun jugement. Finalement , en appliquant une matrice d√©cisionnelle comparant 3 mod√®les propos√©s lors du remue-m√©ninges , celui-ci √† d√©montrer que le CAAE √©tait le meilleur concept. Suite √† cette prise de d√©cision, nous sommes pass√©s aux prototypes . 

Le Capteur d'Angle Azimut et d'√âlevation ou (CAAE) est le future pour la prise de mesures ballistiques. Cette m√©thode utilise un Arduino UNO R3 qui communique √† un capteur BNO055 afin d'imprimer les mesures sur un √©cran LCD. 

Composantes:
- BNO055 
- Arduino Uno R3 (interchangeable avec arduino nano)
- Imprimant 3D
- LCD 1602
- Pile √† 9

Title: BeEco
Desc:
The project of ‚ÄúWaste Management‚Äù was a project assigned to the teams by the client Mitch Bouchard. Mitch Bouchard is part of a family business in the field of mechanical part supply. This project has a goal of improving the quality of recyclables and decreasing waste in landfills by creating a system to assist people in sorting their recyclables properly. Though many individuals believe that recycling is enough to make a change in the world this is not the case when looked at on a large scale. Many recyclables are missorted and end up in landfills and/or shipped overseas to countries that have more room for landfills than Canada does. In fact, many people do not know how to recycle and opt for throwing everything into the garbage instead resulting in further pollution in our environment. Creating a product to help people learn and understand how to sort their recyclables and garbage easily could help in the big picture of managing and reducing the amount of waste on the planet.  

The team has designed BeEco a webpage to help the users sort their recycling accurately. The product was developed using IBM Watson Visual Recognition to train the website to recognize the material the object is made of. Then the coding algorithm would indicate the correct bin from the material identified.

Title: GNG2101 Team D1 - BAPN Designers - Mealtime
Desc:
In this design project, our team was entrusted with producing a mealtime carbohydrate tracking application for diabetic users that will regulate their diabetic conditions and increase harm-reduction efforts amongst all users.

The main priority that was established at the beginning of the design process was that first and foremost, we needed to empathize with our client and truly understand their needs and wants.

The design of our mobile application is that of an ADD-friendly one created using MIT App Inventor that allows the user to input up to 5 meals and for each of these meals, the resultant carbohydrate contents (sugars, starches and fibers) are displayed for the user to see. This data is then stored in the app. The user can select from four different meal categories; breakfast, lunch, snack and dinner. The user can also view their past meal history, all given personal information, and can take note of their meal history data and send that to their healthcare professionals, for further analysis of one's diabetic conditions. All in all, our app will help aid in regulating many diabetic users' lives. 

The cost to make the app was $0 and is free-to-use. Some struggles that one might face in replicating our design are creating complex functions such as the addition of Bluetooth (Wi-Fi-independency), not exceeding the maximum storage capabilities, and making the app aesthetically pleasing to view. Since App Inventor is free-to-use, it does not have the visual appeal that other app designing programs have.

Please note that the attached .aia file contains the app's source code and is the one to be edited in the App Inventor web application, while the .apk file only allows for viewing the app when downloaded onto one's computer or mobile device. Detailed instructions for sharing and downloading/running the application are listed in the link below.
 
http://appinventor.mit.edu/explore/ai2/share#:~:text=Sharing%20your%20app%20for%20use&text=apk%20file)%20by%20going%20to,the%20email%20from%20their%20phone.

The members of our team include:

Abdel Baig

Ansh Patel

Benjamin Akkinusi

Bora Baskaya

Dylan Neil
