Title: Fog Off
Desc:
During the Covid-19 pandemic it has proven difficult for some people to properly wear a mask, especially with glasses. The mask and glasses combo can cause individuals' glasses to fog up impending their vision. This contributes to raised possibilities of contracting the virus (due to improper wearing of masks so that they can see) and as a result tightened anxiety. 

This is where *Fog Off! can help, keeping your glasses clear of fog for no more Fo*ging problems!
This device is in two pieces, one to be adhered to the face under the mask and one attached once the mask has been placed on ones face. The apparatus keeps glasses from fogging and improves the overall fit of the mask. *Fog Off! is reusable and can be simply washed with soap and water!

Title: The Sixth Sense - All in One Module
Desc:
Problem Statement: 

  • JAMZ requires a climate sensor, shake alarm, anti-theft system and beacon that measures and transmits consistent and accurate data. The module must be safe, inexpensive, lightweight and compact.

Our Solution:

  • GNG1103 group D15, The Sixth Sense provides a violent shake, temperature and humidity sensors, an emergency beacon and anti-theft system. All this while being under $50, waterproof, light weight, accurate and providing a large amount of flagship data. 

What Sets Us Apart 

  • Not only do we offer a solution that covers all 4 of JAMZ's needs, but we have gone to great lengths to ensure the module is user-friendly, easy to update and fix, all while having the best parts for the lowest price.
  • In addition, we at the Sixth Sense have delicately and thoughtfully considered elements requested by the client that many other groups have ignored such as: soldering our components for a stronger and more secure connection, a voltage pull down converter to take the 44V volts given by JAMZ and reducing it to a much more manageable 5V, and finally as to not overload JAMZ's onboard raspberry Pi with unnecessary data we decided to send a flag indicator to warn the operator if there is a problem rather than all the raw data. 

Technical Notes 

  • Weight Analysis (Kg)
Sensor Module  | 0.046682286
Arduino Module  | 0.067932716
Wires and Step down converter  | 0.107540864
Total | 0.222155866

Red - Shake
Blue - Temperature 
Yellow - Humidity 
Mix - Multiple 
White - All or beacon

Title: GNG1103-F3-SupahHawtFiyah
Desc:
Problem Statement: It is suspected that the sodium chloride salt used for uOttawa‚Äôs winter maintenance is potentially reducing the service life of campus infrastructure and damaging the environment. The University requires a cost-effective and less damaging alternate solution.

Title: GNG1103-F12-Wolf Fifth
Desc:
Jonathan Rausseo, Officer of Campus Sustainability at the University of Ottawa conveys a need to have a cost-effective alternative to removing snow and ice from walkways and sidewalks that is either rollable or modular, lightweight and easy to store.

Our team tackled this problem by coming up with a modular heated sidewalk. The sidewalk features a central, self automated control system that controls the heating of the sidewalk. 

The sidewalk is very grippy due to the material that is used and is also very durable. In fact, the material is recyclable making it environmentally friendly. The material also has channels, allowing for water channelling in order to prevent ice/water accumulation on top.

As mentioned, the sidewalk is scalable and modular. This is because the sidewalks feature easy magnetic and water tight electrical connections. Therefore, it is very easy to attach multiple units. 

The sidewalk is also accessible and inclusive as an end piece is designed to have a slight ramp to it. This makes it easy for people using things like scooters or wheelchairs to get easily on and off the sidewalk.

Title: JAMZ- Group A13 GNG1103 Project
Desc:
This project was completed in our GNG1103 class for clients JAMZ a drone delivery service to promote contactless delivery during the 2020 COVID-19 pandemic. The members of this team were Maurice Hartlieb, Mathieu Lagac√©-O‚ÄôConnor, Brad Cole, and Jean Gaster.

Our overall was to provide the JAMZ delivery service with a simplistic and user-friendly interface for their drone delivery app. This app will coordinate with the drone to help users access and use it without difficulty. The app is designed to inform users of any trouble with the delivery of their package, real-time tracking of the drone, and the ability for users to customize their interface with personal favorites. This app will be used to order food, track the delivery drone, and lastly allow the user to confirm delivery. Although the app is not entirely complete we have attached the reports and progress of our project.

The User Guide attached will help individuals recreate our work using the application Android Studios. (The link attached below are clips on how the app will work)

Title: Node 14 - SensAct User Interface
Desc:
Node-14 is a customizable User Interface that allows patients to communicate with their surroundings and others. The previous interface was implemented with Java and complicated with overwhelming options that requires some technical and electronic background knowledge to navigate. 
Without access to a simple User interface, it will become extremely difficult for a healthcare professional to navigate and set up the desired configuration for a patient to use. We have developed a simple and intuitive user interface that will allow healthcare workers to easily navigate and set up the required accessibility devices for disabled patients. It is customized based on the patient's needs and takes an average of only 4 clicks to get to the desired outcome. Our solution will increase both work efficiency and patient comfort which is absolutely necessary in hospitals and other healthcare facilities.

Title: GNG2101 - Wio Link User Interface E24
Desc:
Problem Statement:

St. Vincent hospital has expressed a need for an accessible, user friendly system that enables patients with disabilities to communicate with medical staff and interact with their environment using their everyday devices. 

Our Solution:

The general structure of the product includes a user interface that was coded using Node-Red in order to ensure simplicity within the design. The interface has a simple two menu function. The first menu includes the client‚Äôs interface; it displays a ‚Äúcall nurse‚Äù button, a technical support button and the input option(s) pre-selected by the nurse to fit the needs of the patient.

Pitch: https://youtu.be/FxpsTK9auF8

Title: B13 AR Construction Application
Desc:
Application made with Unity that allows users in the construction industry to display their 3D models real-time into their current environment through the use of augmented reality. Taking the information from the 3D model, the application will be able to display different layers of the model and other data, giving the user a plethora of perspectives of the model and aid in the conceptualization of the final product. Compatible with both IOS and Android devices.

Title: GNG1103-B01-1-IRIS
Desc:
We developed an application that allows the user to visualize 3D models on construction sites. This was made for workers on construction site because they have to translate 2D models into real life 3D models and being able to picture the 3D model would make creating the real model easier. There were no costs associated with the making of the app. Our app includes positional markers and game controls for easy and smooth navigation. 

To access the project files click this link: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1Z1783uXUyd7Co90ySzg4HBF-5hIXlEAL?usp=sharing

Title: GNG1103-A14-JAMZ Food Delivery Application
Desc:
Problem Statement:

JAMZ needs a modern, simple and easy-to-navigate drone food-delivery service application targeted toward rural areas outside of Ottawa who have limited access to other food-delivery services.

The solution we bring forth is a phone application that allows users to quickly and easily order food from their phone. Taking inspiration from popular food delivery apps such as SkipTheDishes and Uber Eats, and using the development platform Thunkable, we have created an app that is intuitive for veterans and newcomers alike. With many features that allow for the personalization and ease-of-use such as an account page, an order history, a shopping cart, etc..., this app best suits the needs of the suburban and rural population with it minimalistic and accesible design.

This project has cost no money.

If this project were to be duplicated, many difficulties would be faced in recreating the design as Thunkable is not the most customizable platform, though as this project is public, it could be directly duplicated to obtain an identical version. It is also noted that when working with Thunkable, it would be preferable to adjust size by percentage and not by pixel as Thunkable develops for every phone and every phone has different dimensions.

Title: GNG 1103 JAMZ UI by team Risk Free A11

There is a need for a simple, yet innovative, user interface for a drone delivery service directed towards individuals living in rural areas. Our team chose to design a website, using Wix, for customers while focusing on ample functionalities and minimalism. Our team spent a total of $33.57 with upgrading to Wix premium. It is important to note that Wix has several constraints, therefore our team would suggest to test the functionalities of Wix in the beginning to get a sense of the feasibility of ideas. 
The website can be accessed with this link: https://daudliaqat2001.wixsite.com/website-2

customize their profile, view a variety of restaurants, select the food options they want, and track their order in real-time with ease.

Title: GNG2101-E23-PiMenu
Desc:
The Pi Menu is a product created by team E23 under the supervision of Bocar N‚Äôdiaye. This is our approach to facilitating the use of smart devices for those affected by limited mobility. 

The Pi Menu is an accessibility application that includes 3 main features. It enables users with accessibility needs to check and respond to their emails, listen to music, and watch videos with minimal physical efforts and 3rd party assistance.
It includes clean, clutter free visuals, which makes it easy to maneuver through the application. Additionally, minimal clicking id required to navigate through the application. 

There is currently no other product on the market that compares to the Pi Menu.

Title: VizBIM
Desc:
In construction, the translation from 3D CAD drawings to 2D blueprints and back to a 3D building can cause needless errors and take time. VizBIM uses AR technology and the Unity software to skip the 2D transition and load Building Information Models directly into the real world using every day cell phones. This project was free to make, using free assets in the Unity store. Possible launching points to continue this project are marrying the front end and back end, adding opacity sliders for the layers, and getting the application onto a mobile device.

Created by Fall 2020 GNG 1103 Group B04

Title: GNG1103B6 AR Project by Futurlistic

This project was created with the purpose of implementing augmented reality technology into the construction industry to improve productivity, ease of work and communication between the company and its employees. Using the Unity software, we created a free application that the client will be able to use to view 3D models of the building plans on any mobile device. Reminding them about taking medicine, eating proper meals, or even recording extra condiments that one may forget. We are going to cover it all.

Title: Helpo - Your Photoshop Assistant A3
Desc:
Photoshops landscape is large, confusing, and difficult to learn for disabled artists. Helpo is a photoshop assistant designed to increase the digital art app's accessibility through interactive tool select feedback, voice commands, and a physical tool keyboard. The project could be built for less than $40. Groups trying to replicate this project should watch out for the scope of the project; it's very easy to forget about one area when progress is being made in another. Possible steps forward include: improving the colour picker design while keeping it accessible (no colour cloud), adding the option for line smoothing, a cleaner integration into the photoshop interface, the ability to select specific brush sizes and colours from Helpo directly, and the ability to select favourite tools or brushes.

If you want to use this software, please download the Helpo_8.zip and Helpo.xml files. Unzip the .zip file and run the installer. To load up a profile, go to the top right, select load, and select the Helpo.xml file.

Made by Fall 2020 GNG 2101 - Accessible Digital Drawings Group A3. Made possible using GAVPI software.

Title: GNG2101-B34-MANA
Desc:
Manager for Audio Notification Accessibility. A GNG2101B34 Team Project.

Group Members: Michael Kagnew, Joseph Francis, Fatimah Vakily, Gabriel Cordovado, Emma Ballantyne, and Jasmine Kokkat


The client is a legally blind graphic artist who seeks software which can read notifications and messages to him; the client is looking for a smarter application than the ones currently available to him. Our solution is MANA, an Android application, which reads incoming messages aloud in two languages, English and Spanish. 

MANA costs $6 for a monthly subscription and $50 for a yearly subscription. When working with our application, it may be difficult to make it more secure and integrate more apps that can have notifications read aloud. Expanding on features in Google Assistant may be difficult due to the limited documentation as well.

https://github.com/GNGB34/accessible-messaging-droid

Title: GNG2101-B11-AimEye
Desc:
People with a low to high visual impairment are in need of an assistive device, or application to aid their use of smart technology. This device should include voice recognition technology, screen selection readers, availability in multiple languages, and should be compatible with other devices and their applications.

Our Solution is AimEye, a multi-platform screen reader and device navigation application. AimEye reads text on screens, allows for voice commands to navigate the device, and allows for voice-to-text messages in external appliactions.

AimEye costs $30.00 CAD per year.

AimEye is unique because of the unintrusive nature of how it functions on devices. By working mostly in the background without changing how the device is used, our design is hard to replicate.

Project Pitch Video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hru9OVTJlI8

Title: GNG2101-B25-MacroGimp
Desc:
Problem Statement: Design a computer application that facilitates the utilization of Adobe Photoshop or GIMP tools for a person suffering from visual processing issues. 

Solution: An Electron desktop application that serves as a custom toolbar for GIMP. The buttons in the application trigger macro files and the app also has a voice search feature.

Cost: $0.00

Struggles while duplicating the design: In order to run the code of the application, Node.js and many of its modules such as Electron.js must be installed. Furthermore, a Google API Key is required for the voice search command. Finally, some preferences in GIMP must be changed.

GitHub Repository: https://github.com/hongyuewang/macrogimp

Technologies Used:
Node.js: https://nodejs.org
Electron: https://www.electronjs.org
SpeechRecognition: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SpeechRecognition
AutoHotkey: https://www.autohotkey.com

Title: GNG2101-B24-Library Wayfinding
Desc:
The uOttawa Library lacks accessibility for people with visual impairments or other disabilities. We designed a wayfinding website that gives audio and visual directions to various waypoints throughout the library so that someone can easily get around. The cost of this project was $0 as everything was designed on a computer using free software. We have mapped out the directions from every way point to every other waypoint so that someone can get anywhere in the library without needing to return to an origin. This represents over 100 different combinations of directions. Using a text to speech API, we are able to bring audio cues which read the visual directions to the user. With this, we hope to make the uOttawa library more accessible to all. https://uottawawayfinding.wordpress.com

To access and edit the website, an invitation must be sent through email to become an administrator, at which point the user or client may modify the site settings and invite people on their own.

Our solution includes using Processing programming to build the drawing program from the ground up. This way, all features and specifications of the client can be met without the hinderance of unwanted features. 

The cost for this project is $0 since it is a software project based off of a free program. 

One thing to watch out for when attempting this project is trying to adapt OpenSource programs. This seemed feasible in the beginning however it became evident that this route would not be possible. Builing from the beginning is a better option.

Title: GNG2501 SensAct UI FA24
Desc:
Plusieurs patients de l'h√¥pital St-Vincent, √† Ottawa, souffrent d‚Äôun handicap physique. Ce handicap affecte beaucoup leur capacit√© de mouvement. Certains n‚Äôont qu‚Äôune motricit√© tr√®s limit√©e. 

Le probl√®me, c‚Äôest que ce handicap les emp√™che de pouvoir interagir avec plusieurs appareils √©lectroniques que nous utilisons tous les jours, que ce soit une t√©l√©vision, un ordinateur, un lecteur de musique ou autre. Ces appareils faisant partie int√©grale de notre vie sont presque une n√©cessit√© au 21e si√®cle. Ils nous servent √† rester connect√©s avec le monde qui nous entoure, chose qui est encore plus importante durant cette pand√©mie. 

C‚Äôest l√† que SensAct vient en jeu. Cet appareil, lorsqu‚Äôil est connect√© √† divers capteurs ou m√©thodes d‚Äôentr√©es, joue le r√¥le d‚Äôune sorte de t√©l√©commande pouvant interagir avec les appareils mentionn√©s plus haut. 

 Or, puisque chaque patient est diff√©rent et peut avoir besoin de diff√©rents capteurs connect√©s √† SensAct, pouvant contr√¥ler diff√©rents appareils, chaque SensAct doit √™tre programm√© sur mesure pour chaque patient. 

Or, l‚Äôinterface d√©j√† en place pour faire cette t√¢che n‚Äôest pas intuitive, ce qui fait que bien que SensAct soit fonctionnel, personne ne peut vraiment programmer un appareil pour chaque patient.

 Pour r√©gler ce probl√®me, nous avons donc mis en place une interface intuitive et facile d‚Äôutilisation qui permettrait au personnel de la sant√© et aux patients de programmer leur SensAct facilement et en peu de temps, afin de leur permettre de contr√¥ler leurs appareils √©lectroniques. 

Il n'y a aucun co√ªts associ√©s √† notre interface, elle est impl√©ment√©e avec node-red, qui est un outil de programmation intuitif.

Pour utiliser notre interface, il faut t√©l√©charger NodeJs et ensuite installer node-red. Il faudra aussi t√©l√©charger quelques modules dans node-red, qui seront sp√©cifi√©s quand vous essayez d'ex√©cuter les flows.

Title: Contr√¥leur Ambu bag FA34

Title: An data tracking device for gym users
Desc: The LiftSmart is a device aimed at high-level trainers and players of any sports who wish to track useful data during their workouts. Our processing chip makes use of powerful software that can recognize movements and track useful metrics such as power generated during your lifts, the type of lift completed, and the trajectory of the bar during the exercise allowing for corrections of the athlete's form and therefore reducing the risks for injuries. One can visualize the data obtained during a workout on his phone using our mobile application, allowing him or her to monitor progress anytime, anywhere. This will make it easy for anybody to find ways to improve and plan out future workouts accordingly. With LiftSmart, progress will truly be with you wherever you go.

Title: B21 Auditus
Desc:
B21-Waterproof hearing aid

The statement to the problem is : To design and produce a functional set of waterproof hearing aids while still optimizing the functionality and user experience for people who suffer with hearing loss.

Proposed Solution: Our design idea was to modify an over-the-ear hearing aid that is rechargeable with a Micro USB cable and to modify it to produce a hearing aid that is waterproof, thus, functional when immersed in water. This was done by waterproofing the electronics, microphone and charging port separately. To waterproof the charging port, we used a magnetic charger with a removable charging head. We then plug the charging head in and seal it using either silicon glue  so that it remains in place to block off the charging port and stop water from entering. The hearing aid will then be recharged just by attaching the magnetic cable to the end of the charging head.  This method of charging will ensure that the charging port is sealed at all times. To waterproof the electronics, we disassembled the casing on the hearing aid and cover all the electronics, except for the microphone which will be covered by a different material, in clear nail polish. We then put the casing back on. This will allow the nail polish to act as a second barrier of waterproofing in case any water were to enter the hearing aid and come into contact with the electronics.

Cost: The total cost to produce this headset is about $43 at the time of purchasing the materials.

Problem points: If this project will be duplicated insure that you have a good seal around the microphone with the waterproof fabric. Also ensure that multiple of coats of clear nail polish are applied to the electronics and hearing aid. Although it is not required, sealing the seams of the hearing aid with silicon caulking or clear nail polish adds an extra layer of protection against moisture.

Title: Green Tide - La Jardini√®re Automatique - GNG1503 Groupe A6
Desc:
Projet GNG1503, Automne 2020

Dans le cadre du cours GNG1503 (G√©nie de la conception), nous avons le d√©fi de concevoir une jardini√®re d'int√©rieur pour les espaces communs de l'Universit√© d‚ÄôOttawa pour notre client Jonathan Rausseo, gestionnaire du d√©veloppement durable. Monsieur Rausseo nous a expliqu√© qu‚Äôil y a un manque de verdure sur le campus et que les √™tres humains sont biophiles, nous avons tendance √† interagir avec la nature. Il aimerait apporter plus de verdure dans les espaces communs √† l‚Äôaide de planteurs autosuffisants. Notre budget pour ce projet est de 100$.

The purpose of this project is to create a way for her to keep a visual timeline of all the annotated and reviewed documents and how the information might flow from one to another.

Title: openChem VR F10
Desc:
Utilizes a repository of open-source VR components collectively used for assembling a university-level lab environment suitable for macro-micromolecular visual learning; simulating chemistry labs on HTC vive VR environments.


The Folder 'Project 1' Contained the environment the user would be in, allowing the user to experience a kitchen like scenario in the macroscopic level.

The Folder 'Project V1' contained the microscopic environment with molecules interacting with one another and with the user, all depending on how the user interacted in macroscopic scenario

.

The openChem repo is created by Tony Kim, Azfar Azfar, Ahmed Osman, Bradley Liu and contains our projects under file names: "Project 1" and "ProjectV1", which uses certain assets and components from repos "SBHacks" and "Atomive": two libraries that have been forked into the openChem repo for redundance and easy asset importability within project 1 and V1.. Sources for SBHacks and Atomive are cited in read-mes of each repository file.

Meanwhile, we also developed the night work mode based on IR camera to make it able to work automatically at night. Our prototype and functional testing are finished as well as the analysis of usability, scalability, sustainability and other necessary analysis.

Title: Tactile Map GNG-5140 G8
Desc: Navigating in a foreign space for a visually impaired person can be extremely challenging. The Public Health Agency of Canada is looking to create a tactile map for the blind using 3D printers or other suitable technologies, to make the first floor of 100 Colonnade Rd, accessible for employees with vision impairments. This is part of the accessible and inclusive meeting spaces initiative, which is serving as the benchmark for accessibility within the public service, and is informing the work being done within Centre Block and the Parliamentary Precinct. The end result will be presented to the subcommittee on tactile mapping for the Parliamentary Precinct, which is currently exploring options for tactile mapping on Parliament Hill.

Title: GNG1103F Chemistry VR group F4
Desc:
For our design project, we developed a VR environment that consists of an interactive map with different stages that guide the user through the different levels of a titration reaction. We chose this design since it forces the user to follow a particular order, which ensures proper understanding of each stage before moving on to the next. The environment itself is very intractable as the user can move around, play with different objects, as well as use a bow and arrow to answer the quiz questions that test what they have learnt in the VR. The objective of this environment is to allow users to visualize the difference in between the macroscopic and microscopic levels of a chemical reaction.


There is a link to download what exists of the reaction part of the project here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1gb1DyOgVqO2mafqBohARS1DteLv_2l_2/view?usp=sharing

Title: GNG 1103 Hydroponics 4 - Winter 2020 Professor Majeed
Desc: The proposed aeroponics design is easy to make, relatively cost efficient and extremely efficient at germination of crops. Aeroponics is a form of hydroponics which uses pressure to spray a mist of a nutrient rich solution at the roots of the growing crops. Aeroponics is efficient because it reduces the need for a growth medium which frees the roots up completely allowing for full coverage of the water solution across the surface of the plants' roots. The system we proposed is also a closed loop system meaning that the water is 95% reused and thus infrequently requires refilling of water. The nutrients would need to be resupplied to the system when they are running low, but are also relatively cheap so could be bought in bulk. The system requires a power source of 120VAC at 60 Hz, and produces a stream of water with 300 GPH (gallons per hour).

Title: GNG 1503-FB5-Dispositif de mesure de pression
Desc:
Concevoir, pour les formateurs au piano, les chercheurs et les apprenants, un dispositif de mesure de pression de petite taille, tr√®s sensible, facilement d√©montable, d'un prix abordable et qui est capable d'enregistrer les donn√©es mesur√©es puis les afficher sur un √©cran sous forme de graphique facile √† interpr√©ter et comprendre.

La solution retenue pour r√©pondre aux besoins du client est un dispositif constitu√© d'un microcontroleur Aduino Mega muni de quatre capteurs et d'un module bluetooth permettant de transmettre les donn√©es de pression √† distance. Une application permet de visualiser les graphiques en temps r√©el sur un √©cran.

Le co√ªt total du projet est de 63,29 $CAD.

Les principales difficult√©s rencontr√©es lors de la r√©alisation du projet sont: la r√©alisation et le t√©l√©versement du code ainsi que la connexion du bluetooth sur l'arduino Nano.

Title: Project Armadillo C3
Desc:
There are thousands of people with disabilities who are unable to pursue their dreams due to their limitations.

Our project is to ensure that everyone has a source of accessibility and an equal opportunity to do what they love regardless of their struggle.

We have created a ramp that will last for 2 months outside, is portable and will handle 500 pounds of weight.

Title: C7 OP-Watch
Desc:
In this design project, our team was entrusted with producing an electronic device in response to the growing epidemic of the opioid crisis.


The main priority that was established at the beginning of the design process was that first and foremost, we needed to empathize with the user and truly understand their needs and wants.


Opioid users range from all sorts of age demographics; these include the homeless, adolescents, and even those employed in trades-based industries.


The design of our device is that of a watch which measures one's heart rate and oxygen saturation levels. These values, alongside the GPS tracking system coordinates, are then directly sent to the mobile application. A call is made to the user's emergency contact, who can then forward the call to emergency services if additional assistance is needed. All in all, our device will help save many lives and rescue others from potential life-threatening circumstances.



The members of our team include:


Abdel Baig


Ali Al-Zaidi


Bilal Ahmad


David Onoruvwe


Yazan Elmasry

Title: Greenhouse Construction 2
Desc: The need exists for members of the Algonquin of Barriere Lake community to increase their food supply with the availability of sustainable greenhouse (hydroponic system) that is self-sufficient, easy to control, compact, insulated, affordable, and able to provide warmth all year for growing plants.

Title: GNG2101-D1-FLASH-E
Desc:
Did you know that in 2019, 4.4 million people suffered fatal injuries in emergency situations? Overcome with fear of something similar happening to her, our client came to us seeking a functioning emergency call device capable of reaching and sending out a quick alert to emergency services in the event of a dangerous situation.

Our team has developed a watch-like device and a mobile application of medium-high fidelity. In the featured prototypes, we have a complete watch assembly consisting of a watch case, watch bezel, watch crystal, a button, and a band. The watch is a simple design that can be easily worn on the wrist ensuring accessibility at all times. It is easily connected to the mobile application through strong and wide ranged bluetooth connectivity, accommodating the event that a user wearing the watch is separated from their phone. In terms of functionality, the user must simply hit the button that is found at the centre of the watch which will activate the device and send out a signal to request emergency aid as it is already connected to the app and optimized to the user.

Our prototypes were developed using Solidworks, 3D printing, Adafruit Bluefruit Circuit Playground, Laser cutting, and Android Studio.

Title: GNG1103D02 GHConstruct 3
Desc:
Problem Statement: The community of the Algonquins of Barriere Lake are in need of a safe, self-sustaining and affordable greenhouse that can provide produce for an extended amount of time, throughout the year.

Our Solution: We have creating an affordable, modular and low maintenance greenhouse design, that will produce vegetables through the different seasons in Barriere Lake

The Cost: $372.12

Problems/ issues faced through replication: If you are looking to replicate our design, it is important to note that many of the materials and tools were provided by the school. This is important to note as the directions are based on what our group was able to complete in the time given. Altercations may be made to fit the needs and wants of the replication. For instance our original design had a 4x8 base until we changed it to a 6x8 base to optimize space inside the greenhouse.

Title: C12 LIFELINE
Desc:
For this project, we were tasked to create a device that confronts the uprising opioid overdose crisis. In order to create an ideal device, we needed to gain a strong understanding of who the user would be. In this case, it is those who are blue collar or in construction, and we tried our best to accommodate to their needs and lifestyle.

We designed a wristwatch device that would measure heart rate and blood oxygen saturation levels which would directly connect to our phone application and alert help in the case of an overdose.

We hoped to provide our users an easy and affordable way at a second chance at life or in other words a lifeline.


Makers of this project include:

Abdullah Abdulmajeed

Alyssa Wang

Antonia Zupu

Spencer Henry

Yomna Elsahili

Title: Rear View Mirror G6
Desc: No desc

Title: Opioid Overdose Device - Team C13
Desc: For this semester's GNG1103, my group, Team 13, was asked to make a device that detects overdose opioids and contacts emergency services within 3 minutes in an attempt to save the person overdosing's life. During the client meeting we were informed that the best way to recognize an opioid overdose is by checking Blood Oxygen levels using an oximeter; if ones SPO2 dips below 85% the chance of them having an overdose is really high. This project required a lot of programming and electrical knowledge to work. We worked a lot with codes, Arduino Controllers, Sensors, Bluetooth etc. to make this project work. We also took advantage of the school's 3D printers. Our final project was supposed to be a watch with an inbuilt pulse oximeter that connects to an app. This app with receive your heart rate and blood oxygen levels and will contact your emergency contact when having an overdose. Unfortunately due to COVID-19 we were unable to complete the project.

Title: GNG2101 - C4 - Emergency Call Bell
Desc:
The Client, Victoria, an elderly woman, needs an emergency call bell that can detect when she falls or can be manually triggered to call the emergency services for her.

An emergency call bell system implemented with a Fitbit smartwatch and an Android smartphone.

GNG2101 Group C4 - Winter 2020

Title: GNG 1103 - Chemistry VR set using UNITY F3
Desc: Virtual reality (VR) has the ability to help users visualize and interact with a variety of abstract subject matter. This product will utilize the power of VR to allow students to interact with molecules at a microscopic level and develop an understanding of difficult concepts. The target group is students who have a background in general chemistry, and are proceeding to introductory organic chemistry. This product uses technology to connect the effects of macroscopic and microscopic reactions.

Title: Lookout C8
Desc:
An earpiece device that accurately detects an opioid overdose using a oximeter sensor. Once detected the device sends a text alert and the location of the user to a third party so naloxone can be administered in under 3 minutes.

Title: GNG1103C5VibeMachines
Desc: Our client requires a transportable, weather-resistant greenhouse that can feed up to five people while needing minimal maintenance, being self-powered, and automatically watered. The greenhouse should be low-cost while remaining easy to use. Our solution reflects these criteria while coming in at $388 or $112 under budget. The single biggest obstacle in the construction process was COVID-19.

Title: Greenhand Construction - Construction 1
Desc:
Greenhand Construction has created a greenhouse structure that maximizes both its efficiency and safety precautions. The basic design of our structure involves various tresses and beams to assure integrity. As a result we have also created a single-roofed greenhouse with plentiful sunlight accessibility to control the flow of water and deliver it to the hydroponics system.

However, due to unforeseen circumstances, the greenhouse will not be finished and we are only left with what we have already done.

Desc: Convert a rowing machine, using a detachable adapter, to make it wheelchair-accessible for people who suffer primarily from lower-body disabilities.

Title: Adaptive Game Controller- Group C1 - RPGenius
Desc: Game controller designed for our client for one-handed use. Combination of a keyboard and joysticks for easy adaptation. It feature 21 keys which can be customized based on one's preferences. It is ergonomically designed around the palm of your hand and XIM apex compatible.

Title: GNG 2101-C6-Sensory Chair
Desc: The purpose of the sensory chair is to allow those with disabilities or growth defects to be more comfortable and help sleeping. As our customers will much of their time sitting on the chair, we want to create a chair that allows the user to remain comfortable and relaxed for a long period of time. This is accomplished by structuring the chair to accommodate a variety of sitting and laying positions, notably on the users front and back. First, we coded the motor to change the direction and speed of the motor through an Arduino Micontoller. This motor is placed at the centre of the base of the chair and is attached to the chair itself. The rocking system works by using a gear that pulls along a chain, pulling the chair with it. A spring was added to keep chain tension, allowing for smooth and consistent rocking.

Title: Team C1 Never Close to an Overdose
Desc: Opioid overdose detection device. Our device will detect when the user is having an overdose, and through our app it will notify an emergency contact chosen by the user. The device is located at the users ankle, the pulse oximeter will read the users blood oxygen saturation level from the users achilles heel.

Title: GNG2101-C5-One Step
Desc: People with Parkinson's sometimes have trouble starting a movement. When they are stationary for a while or have just risen from a chair for example, it takes a little encouragement to get their legs moving. Our project involves insoles that are able to vibrate when triggered by an app to mimic walking for our client and stimulate walking.

Title: GNG1103-KELT-Hydroponics 6
Desc: There was need for a functional and cost-effective hydroponics system in a greenhouse that would be easy to use and maintain and provide food for 4-5 people. We designed a drip hydroponics system to solve this problem. The expected building cost of this system would be $79.30. The trickiest part of our design is arguably controlling the flow rate and ensuring all plants get equal amounts of nutrient solution.

Desc:
Our problem statement: A need exists for people who use opioids to safely have their blood oxygen saturation monitored and location quickly sent to emergency services in case of overdose, with a device that is discrete and cost-effective.

Our solution to the problem is a device of a combination of a pulse oxygen saturation ring and a watch that is connected via a thin wire. The ring and the watch would be battery powered as well as have a GPS system within it.

Title: O2-POD -- An Opioid Overdose Monitoring Device C6
Desc:
The opioid crisis has caused over 10 000 overdose deaths in Canada since 2016. 94% of those are accidental and young Canadians aged 15-24 are the fastest growing overdose population. Overdoses are happening with both illegal and prescription drugs and touches every sector of the population. The main signs of an overdose is a low respiratory rate and low oxygen saturation levels in the blood.


Our project is to create a device that can detect a person overdosing and send a signal to a loved one/paramedics to alert them that something is wrong and indicate the location of the person. Another important factor is that it must be reliable, not be intrusive or hard to use for the user since they must want to use it consistently.

Title: GNG1103-FO6-VR Chemistry Game
Desc: We need to make a VR-based chemistry game for researchers and professors to better illustrate the misconceptions behind reactions and proportions for organic chemistry university students, Our budget is $100 for the assets required to build the necessary components for the game. The game consists of 2 reactions, one of which is a tutorial. Also, the game will consist of 2 phases, one in the macroscopic phase in the laboratory, and the microscopic phase in order to analyze molecular structure and reaction.

Title: GNG2101 A01 Special Keyboard F2019
Desc: SALA, the Special Adjustable Laptop Arm is designed to help JM, a patient with no arm or leg mobility, to use his laptop more comfortably. He currently uses a mouth-stick to operate his laptop, but the angle and height of his laptop causes him neck strain. As a result, the team designed and produced a prototype that allows JM to set his laptop at a comfortable height and angle. This will reduce his neck pain and prevent future health issues involving neck strain.

Title: Volunteer Call Bell - Fall 2019 A3
Desc:
All server files and current CAD designs can be found in the GitHub repository


A Raspberry Pi acts as a router and provides access to a LAN through Wi-Fi for devices. An API server runs and responds to HTTP GET, POST and DELETE requests by updating or reading a SQLite database. A web server also runs on the Raspberry Pi to provide a web application that allows
patients to submit their calls and volunteers to delete and view the calls. Another Raspberry Pi that connects to the LAN is used as a button. It sends a predetermined HTTP request when the physical button is clicked and is programmed using Node-Red.

Title: GNG2101-A11 -Portable Wheelchair Ramp
Desc:
A need exists to provide a lightweight, compact, portable ramp within $100 that will enable Austin to access areas which are not otherwise accessible to people in wheelchairs due to curbs and tree roots.

Our solution is to build a triangular wheelchair ramp which is capable of folding in half for portability. The ramp is supported by ratched straps running along the bottom.

The current cost of the ramp is $127.70

The biggest struggle we have faced with this project was finding a way to give the ramp enough support without introducing too much weight. The ropes supporting the ramp proved to be an extrememly effective solution.

The cost of our prototype is 109$.

Some problem that might be faces is not getting the joystick to move in the upwards direction. This is caused by the hole in the top piece to be too small which limits the range of motion.

Enfin, notre solution accomode la langue de pr√©f√©rence de l'utilisateur tout en √©tant interractive et accessible aux d√©ficiences auditives et visuelles.

Nous avons donc un mandat important afin de permettre aux visiteurs du mus√©e d'en apprendre davantage sur cette exposition qui pr√©sente le domaine de l'agriculture au Canada.

Title: GNG2101-B1A-Rear view Camera
Desc:
Back up camera and mount that allows the user to see behind them granting the user better awareness of surrounding objects. App enabled software streams footage to phone.




Problem statement

The client, who has limited mobility and visibility in a wheelchair, wants to be able to see behind them to help with spatial awareness when turning, going forward, and reversing to help in avoiding any obstacles in their way. An electronic camera system that could be attached to the wheelchair is the desired solution that would be developed depending on time and money constraints.




Definition

A wide angle camera will be secured to the back of the wheelchair, providing a good field of vision behind the wheelchair. The camera will be secured to the chair with strong durable velcro. The camera will be powered by a usb port found underneath one of the armrests. The video feed from the camera will be displayed on a phone with bluetooth that will be mounted on one of the chair arms. The mount will be adjustable to provide a comfortable angle to view the phone.

Solution

The wide angle camera will allow for a good field of view, and since most cameras that are available are at least 1080p, the video quality should not be an issue. The combined weight of the camera and wires should be rather low, however, the mount for the phone could be an issue in staying under the 600g target. The camera and phone are intended to be connected via bluetooth to reduce the need for additional wiring. The main drawbacks to this design is the power source. Since both the camera and phone will be powered by the chair, the amount of power used must be monitored as to not cause problems with extended use of the chair. Another possible issue is the bulkiness of the phone mount. If the mount is large and obstructive, this may cause problems with the user, therefore it is important to produce a mount that is compact.

Title: GNG2101 - B01D - Wheelchair Camera Mount

Last but not least, this mount is designed so that the user will be able to use both their phone and camera at the same time.

Title: GNG1503 - FA4 - tracteur
Desc:
Bas√© sur un site patrimonial, le mus√©e de l'agriculture et de l'alimentation comporte une ferme exp√©rimentale qui permet au public de se familiariser avec le mode de vie agricole. Plusieurs d√©monstrations de technologies rurales y sont pr√©sentes dont une exposition sur les tracteurs. Par contre, cette derni√®re a √©t√© enlev√© en septembre dernier apr√®s 17 ans. Dans le cadre d'une actualisation de l'exposition, le mus√©e souhaite concevoir et cr√©er un syst√®me d'interaction physique et virtuel accessible √† tous, captivant et √©ducatif, offert dans la langue de choix de l'utilisateur dans une cabine de tracteur John Deere. Ce syst√®me se doit d'offrir une modernit√© technologique dans son interaction et montrer √† l'utilisateur l'agriculture moderne. Pour ce faire, le client a quatre grandes demandes: un co√ªt de projet abordable, une utilisation s√©curitaire, un appareil √©ducatif et interactif ainsi qu'une dur√©e de vie de 10 ans.

Notre solution a √©t√© de fabriquer un panneau de contr√¥le semblable √† ceux que l'on peut trouver dans les divers mus√©es de la r√©gion. Une s√©rie de boutons poussoir d√©marrent des interactions ind√©pendante selon le bouton press√©. √Ä l'appui du bouton principal, un son de moteur et une courte vid√©o d√©marrera. Compl√©mentaire √† celui-ci seront agenc√© 3 histoires d'agriculteurs (dans les deux langues officielles canadiennes) o√π ces personnes parlent de leur contact avec la machinerie. Une derni√®re s√©rie de bouton-pression permettent l'allumage des phares du tracteur.

Le co√ªt de la solution retenue du prototype est d'environ 100$. C'est une solution simple qui permet de visualiser un ensemble plus grand que nature.

Les d√©fis de la r√©alisation de ce projet sont de nature technique. Il faut savoir manipuler les machines de fabrication ainsi que les branchements √©lectroniques au contr√¥leur.

Title: GNG1103 -A3-Inventory Management
Desc: The CEED areas need an inexpensive and effective way to manage their inventory in real time, while keeping the process simple enough to encourage participation. We will solve this problem by keeping track of a scanner to upload data to Dashboard as items are removed or added. The item quantities will automatically be updated as they are used and will be able to be tracked on Dashboard. The user will be able to easily see the quantities available, as well as see an alert when the quantity has dropped below a preset value. The only cost associated with the system is the cost of the scanner as the rest will be taken care of through Dashboard, and possibly for viewing online. A computer will be necessary to run Dashboard but the cot of a computer is not taken into account. Struggles people may have with duplicating the design are likely to be with the operation of the Dashboard interface as it is likely they have not used it before.

Title: GNG2101-A8-Adaptive Communication
Desc:
A need exists to support a Tobii Dynavox I-12+ in a stable fashion on a wheelchair, bed, and hospital bed, while being accessible for our client Treena, maintaining a sleek design, and working within the constraints of cost and time.


Our solution is a robust, modular, fully adjustable segmented arm that is held in place by the weight of a bed, and maintains its orientation through the use of press-and-click locking joints. The arm features a 3D printed tablet mount at its end in which a Tobii Dynavox I-12+ easily slots into, and on the other end a flat base that uses the weight of the bed to keep the whole arm stable.


The cost of our project was roughly $120.

Important details to consider when recreating our design would be to use Adjustable Locking Technologies' Variloc Medium Duty Thermoplastic Hinges, which are a focal part of our project. In addition, the tablet mount is an important load bearing part of the arm and should be printed with a high infill to achieve the ideal strength.

Title: GNG1103 - Group A9 - SD Card QR Code Scanner
Desc:
Our project creates a fast, easy, and expandable system that allows a CEED employee to easily sign out, sign in, and keep track of 3D printers and their corresponding SD Cards. In addition our system allows the easy collection of user feedback.

Our product is based off a Raspberry Pi 4 and employs the use of a RPI Camera. The camera runs custom software that allows the Pi to process and relay information read from QR codes. The QR codes are designed to be printed and attached to an SD card which corresponds to a 3D printer in the makerspace. A CEED employee will have access to both the RPI as well as a dashboard UI. The UI allows for the staff member to easily scan a QR Code, signing it out, or returning it if already signed out. The UI also displays the number of active printers, and the time in which the printer was signed out. The Pi itself also stores a log of active printers, as well as a list of all QR Codes scanned as well as the time the code was scanned in, and out. What makes our project special is the easily expandability, if the makerspace wishes to add more printers, not modification needs to be made to RPI, its software or the Dashboard UI. Simply by printing more QR codes and assigning them a unique value that corresponds to a 3D printer, the scanner will automatically sense the new QR code, and add it to the system without any user modification required.

Title: GNG1103-A19-Automated 3D Printing with OctoPi
Desc:
We want to design a system and user interface that improves the current problems with automating the use of 3D printers, while eliminating the troubles with SD cards to enhance the user and staff experience with 3D printing, organizing, time management, and ease of use.


Through the use of Ross Dashboard we have created a UI that will display the availability of printers, their status, and other key information relevant to the current print job such as time left and filament usage. With the use of OctoPrint in conjunction with HTTP GET Requests, we were able to get these values in real time. OctoPrint allows users to upload STL and g-code files to a raspberry pi connected to the printers. This will decrease wasted time in Makerspace while using 3D printers compared to the current system in place.

1 X Rasbarry Pi 3B+ ....................................................................... $55.97

1 X 16GB Micro SD ........................................................................ $9.30

1 X Printer Cable ............................................................................. $4.43

3 X Printer Cable ............................................................................ $4.60

1 X 3D Printed Case + Stand ................................................. $0

1 X Wall Plug ..................................................................................... $13.99

TOTAL ................................................................................... $101.88

Some struggles people may face in replicating this design is coding. People will have to code the GET Request accordingly for their purpose. Not only that, they will have to be comfortable in accessing the raspberry pi through ssh and being able to create multiple instances of OctoPrint on various ports of the raspberry pi's ip address. To add, people will need to know how to set a static ip address for the raspberry pi. Also, a struggle people may face is coding Ross Video Dasboard for all possible scenarios. Moreover, people will need to know how to code GCODE Scripts for OctoPrint.

Title: GNG1103-F10-Fallen
Desc:
Task:

Work as a team to develop a prototype of a public sculpture for an outdoor art exhibition with an interactive human element, 80% recycled materials and a budget of $100 CAD.

Solution:

Fallen is a sculpture inspired by themes of symbiosis in nature, inverted relationships, tragedy and loss. It contains a human interactive element using an Arduino microcontroller, three ultrasonic sensors and a RGB LED strip. The final sculpture is designed to change the viewers perspectives on dichotomies in nature in addition to giving an exaggerated example of a mutation in nature that we can expect if we continue to poorly manage waste materials as a species.

Cost:

$84.00 not including the Arduino & breadboard (provided by team member)

Title: GNG1103-F7-Distorted View
Desc: Our team was tasked with creating a kinetic art installation made up of at least 80% recycled material. Our goal was to promote recycled art while also exploring the theme of time relativity. Using recycled CD's and mirrors, the sculpture catches the eye with its colorful reflections and distorted images. This effect is enhanced by a simultaneous spinning of both discs. The main reflective disc interacts with the viewers through their own distorted reflections, while the smaller disc symbolizes time and its relativity by spinning faster as people approach and slower as they move away from the sculpture.

Each subsystem was constructed according to the attached schematics inside of a lazer cut box and affixed in the shelter as seen fit. Wiring was then laid between the modules using quick connect connectors wherever needed to ensure modularity.

Title: GNG1503-FB5-Robot de cuisine

Title: GNG1503-B0-Robot de cuisson FB6
Desc:
Nous devions faire un robot de cuisson qui pouvait adapter sa cuisson des aliments selon les saisons, l'humidit√© et le mode de cuisson. L'interaction humaine dans le processus doit √™tre aussi minimale que possible. Le robot doit aussi √™tre muni d'un syst√®me de nettoyage et d.un syst√®me pouvant transmettre la nourriture du bol de cuisson aux assiettes. Le co√ªt total de ce robot doit √™tre de 100$ maximum.

Notre solution est un bol de cuisson de format standard positionn√© sur une plaque chauffante. Ce bol est attach√© √† des servomoteurs faisant basculer le bol vers l'assiette. Un bras robotique m√©lange la nourriture et lave le bol avec un tuyau d'eau savonneuse sur son c√¥t√©. Un servomoteur est aussi attach√© sur le bouton rotatif de la plaque chauffante nous permettant ainsi de contr√¥ler la temp√©rature.

Le co√ªt de ce projet est d'environ 97$.

Les d√©fis √† surmonter sont de trouver des les bons servomoteurs: ils ne sont pas faciles √† trouver et toutes les forces ne sont pas tous disponibles. Les mat√©riaux pour construire ce robot peuvent √™tre vari√©s: il sera difficile de trouver de bons mat√©riaux r√©sistants mais aussi peu co√ªteux.

Title: VR App Bird Simulator E1

The game is a bird flying experience where the user is able to choose a bird and the bird flies them around two islands created by the team. The game is easy to use and does not require any training as all the user needs to do is move their head to enjoy the view of the scenery.

Title: GNG1503-FC2-Fantastic Four Pompe Arterielle
Desc:
Nous avons √©t√© charg√©s de la cr√©ation d'un simulateur de pompe art√©rielle pour les analystes des taches de sang, travaillant pour notre client, le service de police d'Ottawa. Il faudrait qu'on cr√©e un simulateur de pompe art√©rielle pour les analystes de taches de sang pour qu'ils puissent r√©pliquer les pertes de sang des art√®res coup√©es.

Le but de la pompe √©tait de reproduire les mod√®les de projection de sang d'une art√®re sectionn√©e.

Elle est contr√¥l√© √©lectroniquement en entrant des valeurs pour la pression et le rythme cardiaque souhait√©s sur un clavier; ces valeurs sont affich√©es sur un √©cran.

Id√©alement, nous voulions construire un appareil avec un petit r√©servoir de sang et avec des clips de tube de diff√©rentes tailles. Les diam√®tres des tubes varient pour repr√©senter diff√©rentes art√®res.

Lors de la cr√©ation de notre pompe, nous devions prendre en compte des facteurs tels que le co√ªt, les mat√©riaux, le poids, la taille, la portabilit√© et l'efficacit√©.

De plus, des facteurs tels que la pression dans les vaisseaux sanguins r√©els, la circulation sanguine, la fr√©quence cardiaque et d'autres propri√©t√©s physiques des art√®res ont √©t√© pris en compte.

Title: OhmVR E2
Desc: OhmVR is a virtual reality meditation experience designed to provide relaxation and comfort to patients of all ages during both chemotherapy, and radiation treatments. The natural scenery and peaceful meditation soundtracks can be enjoyed in a variety of languages as patients receive treatment while sitting, standing or lying on their back.

Title: GNG1503-B00-FB9-Robot de cuisine Automatise
Desc:
Dans les services alimentaires comme le Thai express, le d√©lai d'attente des clients est relativement grand en raison du fait qu'il est difficile de trouver du personnel qualifi√© et que la formation de nouveau personnel engendre une perte de temps et d'argent. √Ä la vue de toutes ces difficult√©s,

le directeur des services alimentaires de l'universit√© d'Ottawa, Monsieur Patrick Genest, aimerait avoir un robot de cuisine automatis√© qui apporterait la solution √† ces probl√®mes puisqu'il serait divis√© en trois parties; la pr√©paration, la distribution et la cuisson. Il est de notre devoir de concevoir un robot qui prendra en charge la partie cuisson, c'est-√†-dire qu'il effectuera la cuisson d'au moins deux plats principaux en un temps minimis√© et de fa√ßon autonome.

Le co√ªt de notre projet est de 150 $ CA. Ce prix est √©lev√©, car les fournisseurs des composantes que nous avions besoins √©taient les seuls √† pouvoir nous fournir les pi√®ces imm√©diatement.


En apparence, il parait simple de faire ce projet, mais la v√©rit√© est que la r√©alisation de chaque partie constituant le rebot demande de la visualisation et beaucoup de remu-m√©ninges. La mod√©lisation 3D est l'un des d√©fis important √† surmonter.

Au cours de l'assemblage, plusieurs probl√®mes survenaient au fur et √† mesures. Il fallait donc trouver des solutions √† chaque fois.

Title: Le Fantastic Foot F3
Desc: Ce support de pied r√©volutionnaire permet de corriger la position d'un pied qui tourne vers l'int√©rieur en le ramenant et en le gardant droit. Il est beaucoup plus confortable, beaucoup moins encombrant, plus facile √† mettre et plus durable que les produits existants sur le march√©, le rendant unique en son genre. Sa structure personnalis√©e pour chaque client le rend aussi plus efficace.

Title: GNG1503B-FB8-Robot de cuisson
Desc: Dans les restaurents alimentaires du type fast food/casual, il y a un gros manque de chefs, De plus, le service est tr√®s lents ce qui est mauvais pour les restaurents. Comme solution a ce probl√®me, nous avons fabriqu√© un robot de cuisson qui va cuire des repas avec rapidit√© pour augment√© le service √† la clientel. En plus de cuisiner rapidement, le robot va aussi distribuer la nourriture sur les assiettes des clients et se nettoyer donc il n'y aura pas besoin d'interaction humaine pour le mettre en marche. Pour ce projet nous avons eu un budjet de 100 dollars et nous avons utiliser environ 95% de cela. Notre plus gros d√©fi a √©t√© de cr√©er le mecanisme qui servira a transposer la nourriture sur un assiette car nous avons eu a refaire cette partie a plusieurs reprises.

Our client Abas is faced with cerebral palsy. He has a problem self propelling on all surfaces. In terms of mobility he is much more dominant with his right side. With our product Abas would gain independence while bound to his wheelchair.

Title: GNG1103 D1 Construction - Raise the Roof
Desc:

To aid in solving this problem, a temporary housing option for one woman and any possible children is needed. This housing option should be able to accommodate the woman/family for at least one to two months. A miniature house which can be constructed and destructed easily is ideal.

GNG1103 D1 Construction group final project.

Note: Deliverable A is not required to complete the project as it was simply a team contract.

Title: Automation 3-GNG1103
Desc:
The Ottawa Violence Against Women Shelters require modular housing for women escaping violence.

We have created an automated system that controls lighting and cooling in the house. A door alert system will use a light and sound to indicate people approaching the door. Through an arduino we control the lighting system through a motion sensor, and the cooling system through a temperature sensor.

Title: GNG2101-C1A-Voice Remote

Title: GNG1103F-F5-MAD
Desc: The Equilibrium art installation in STEM is currently non-functional and is not being used to its intended full potential. In order to improve the piece, the original designers wish to see an improvement in the reliability as well as the addition of user-interactive elements. The objective of this project is to improve the existing Equilibrium art installation located on a staircase in UOttawa's STEM building. As an improvement, we decided to included an auditory component to the art installation. Two speakers and three ultrasonic sensors are wired through a stair structure to an Arduino board, maintaining a similar design to the original art installation. The total cost for this project amounted to $97.

Title: GNG1103 F3 Temperature Gradient
Desc: Temperature Gradient was designed to complement the pre-exisiting Equilibrium sculpture in STEM by attracting more foot traffic to the stairs. It connects the temperature taken with the sensor to a neopixel strip underneath the overhang of the stairs. We believe that Temperature Gradient is a unique and user-friendly solution to combine Ottawa's daily fluctuating temperatures and the staircase.

Title: The Portionator C2
Desc: : With automation becoming more mainstream nowadays for various reasons, University of Ottawa wanted an automatic kitchen to reduce cost and increase efficiency to give better service to students. In response to that, our group designed an automatic ingredient portioner and dispenser which not only distributes a portion of food for cooking, but also stores bulk of the ingredients in a safe environment for restaurants. We hope to improve efficiency as well as be cost effective in the long run for the owners of the restaurants and the customers who buy food here in University of Ottawa. Our bulk storage will be able to store at least 50 portions of each ingredient for the restaurant, and dispenses one portion of ingredient safely and efficiently when needed.

Title: GNG1103-F2-Infinity Mirror

Title: Porterpal 3000 C3
Desc: Our system transports ingredients from the bulk container to the trays on the rollers which will be automatically activated via servo motors. Inside the bulk container there will be a Archimedes screw which will turn by a motor to push the ingredients out of the container. There will be chains on the side of the rollers which will have gears attached that will turn via servo motors. There will also be plastic rods attached to the chains, when the chains turn the rods will push the trays across the rollers until they reach the cooking station. Bulk containers were made by laser cutting. Rollers were made by drill press. The motors will be controlled by an arduino and the trays were made by 3D printers.

Title: GNG1103-D3-Cardboard Bed
Desc:
Problem Statement:

To provide the domestic violence victims in the city of Ottawa a safe place to sleep, a lightweight bed frame that can support a single 250lb person, be compacted and transported, while being made entirely out of cardboard, needs to be made.


Budget: $100.


Solution

The design of the bed frame consists of four legs that can be nested within each other. The legs have corrugated tops, on which slats of cardboard lay on. Within each individual leg, boxes are situated at the base to provide reinforcement.

Title: Fall Detection System Fall 2018 GNG2101 A3
Desc:

Title: GNG1503-FB7-Robot de cuisson
Desc:
Les Services alimentaires de l'Universit√© d'Ottawa ont charg√© la classe GNG1503B de concevoir un robot de cuisson autonome, abordable, auto-nettoyant, qui cuit les aliments dans un ordre particulier, √† une temp√©rature et une dur√©e sp√©cifique et pr√©cise.

En utilisant la pens√©e conceptuel comme m√©thode de conception et un budget de 100$, le groupe FB7 √† concus un robot √† petite √©chel et deux applications Java pour le contr√¥ler.

Le robot avait des capacit√© de manipuler une po√™le avec un bras √† deux articulations, un pour d√©placer la po√™le vers la gauche et la droite et l'autre pour la faire vers√©. De plus, le robot simulait le malaxage avec un m√©canisme s√©par√© √† une articulation et simulait la cuisson avec des lumi√®res DEL sur une plaque chauffante imprim√© en 3D.

Le robot √©tait contr√¥l√© par deux applications Java. Le premier pour charger une liste d'ingr√©dients avec une dur√©e et une temp√©rature de cuisson sp√©cifique √† chacun. Le deuxi√®me une interface de commande pour le consommateur qui permet de choisire les portions voulus. Tout c'est instruction √©tais envoyer √† un ordinateur Arduino pour activer le robot de cuisson si et seulement si un capteur de pression √©tait activ√© en pla√ßant un bol √† c√¥t√© du robot.

Title: GNG2101-A5-Wheelchair Skis
Desc:
The goal of our group was to create a pair of customized skis that will allow the wheels of a regular wheelchair to traverse through the snow.

Our group's final product is a regular pair of children's skis that has a regular slit in the center of the skis and features a secure locking mechanism that locks the skis to the structure of the wheelchair. Additionally, the wheels of the wheelchair will be placed in the rectangular slit of the skis that enables a unique ability for the wheelchair to traverse through the snow and the payment.

The attached report details the design process and demonstrates the reasoning behind the group's choices.

Title: GNG1103-Construction5-Greenhouse
Desc: A greenhouse is designed and built to address the problem of the client and the needs of the users. Basing from the client's specifications, the Green builders managed to make a greenhouse that could be as sustainable to the users. The team incorporated their ideas into one sustainable greenhouse with five key systems: Insulation, Ventilation, Security, Water Collection, and Electrical power. Wood framing with polyethylene sheets covered with bubble wraps was used as insulation. Holes between the roof and walls were considered as ventilation, and a hanging fan was added to help the air circulation inside the greenhouse. For security, a simple lock is attached to the doors. Gutters were attached on the roof to gather the rainwaters, and the gutters were linked to a pipe that's connected to a storage tank that's inside the greenhouse. A solar panel is put on the roof to collect sunlight and produce electricity for the hydroponics system inside. Limitations such as time and cost were kept in mind. Given the cost limit of $250 dollars, choosing of materials were done wisely. And the whole construction was done in a total of 21-28 hours.

Title: Swiss Chard Machine H5
Desc:
This project was developed for the Barriere Lake First Nations community in La Domaine, QC. This community is home to around fifty people living in a remote area that is about a 1.5 hour drive from the nearest town of Maniwaki, QC. Their location has no access to running water or electricity. The community's water source is mainly from a nearby spring. During the winter time, this community receives large amounts of snowfall and temperature can drop below -30 degrees Celsius. The community needs a way to grow their own fresh produce during the cold winter months.

The team applied the engineering design process to create a hydroponics system capable of sustaining the needs of the Barriere Lake First Nations community year round. This project was developed in tandem with a greenhouse group that were tasked with designing the greenhouse that our system was to rest in.

Title: Fogponics H3
Desc: This goal of the system is to grow fresh fruits and vegetables for a remote community in Quebec. Fogponics uses water in a vaporized form to transfer nutrients and oxygen to enclosed suspended plant roots.

Title: GNG 1103 Fall 2018 Hydroponics 4
Desc: The following Hydroponics system was produced during the Fall 2018 semester of GNG 1103. The goal of the product was to not rely on any forms of electricity to deliver water to the plants. Instead the water was delivered with a manual method using a hand pump. The flow of the water could also be controlled by multiple sets of valves. This product was produced for the Algonquin community of the La Domaine, Quebec, Canada.

Title: Greenhouse Construction 4
Desc:
Greenhouse Construction 4


A rectangular greenhouse with the dimensions 6 ft long x 4 ft wide x 6 ft high, with a traditional triangular roof. The greenhouse was made using wood, 6 millimeter polyethylene for the walls, and corrugated plastic panels for the roof. The side walls disassemble into 3 sections and the back disassembles into 2 sections. They would connect to each other and the floor and roof using nuts and bolts. This was done to increase the portability of the greenhouse, and allow for easier transportation. Windows were added as well to allow for control of air flow in greenhouse. They were made in a way where they would swing on a dowel to open and close. As well, aluminum gutters were attached to the edges of the roof in order to collect water for the hydroponics team.

Title: Hazmat Bowie A4
Desc: The hazmat arm modification for the Bowie robot is designed to allow an untrained operator to safely collect and dispose of hazardous waste, such as needles, without any risk of becoming injured. This is accomplished through the use of an arm replacement that features a sealed container attached to the bottom of the arm. A funneled scoop will guide any hazardous waste into the box, and once all waste has been collected, the box can be removed and disposed of.

Title: Secure Portable Storage Unit for Bowie A14
Desc:
Alternative means for environmental restoration implemented to Erin, from Robot Missions, on the existing Bowie robot during its mission will be evaluated upon its current abilities with an attachment that is lightweight, affordable, and uses materials that are environmentally friendly, to more effectively reduce the amount of litter and pollution on parks and beaches. During the Fall 2018 semester the key focus areas recommended are to prevent a large intake of sand to reduce scoop space for garbage, secure storage where Bowie can dock and recharge while not on duty, and wildlife monitoring and remote surveillance from a good quality camera, along with software.
Our design team has created a Secure Portable Storage Unit. When or if Bowie becomes a fully autonomous robot, it will need to be stored in a shelter. The shelter will protect Bowie from natural weather impacts and provide security for Bowie so there is no direct damage done by humans or animals. Considering natural weather impacts, the storage shelter will need to be durable enough to protect Bowie from wind, heavy rain, and very cold (and/or very hot) temperatures. The storage shelter will need to be big enough to hold Bowie, any non-permanent attachments, and a charging station to reach Bowie's battery. The amount of durable material will need to be determined by triple bottom line.

Title: SpeedPlow - Winter wheelchair accessibility device B3A
Desc: About 1.85 million people in Ontario are in a wheelchair because of a disability. For most of them, the snow season prevents them from going outside, and doing physical activities can be challenging. Our design is an attachable plow that allows people in wheelchairs to easily push snow away. The device also has an easy to use lift function for avoiding obstacles and maneuvering.

Title: Fall Detection System A3

Title: GNG2101-A8-Ice Cube
Desc:
Skating is great exercise and a great social activity. Disabled children want to skate with friends and family. But whereas skating aids currently on the market are designed to stabilize the skater to some degree, they do not arrest a fall and they are not designed to allow an attendant to comfortably or safely help propel or steer the device.

The main focus of our design is to assure that kids with disabilities using the device will not get hurt while skating. Therefore, our design will arrest their fall before they hit the ice and prevent any kinds of injuries. Our target specs explain that we want a small, lightweight design, but also a strong material that will be used to construct our design. The benefits will be a product that brings safety and comfort, opportunity of improve physical and mental health and promote inclusion.

Title: GNG2101 A18 Custom Hand Sanitizer
Desc:
A custom hand sanitizer solution to fit the need of a client with accessibility issues. It utilizes a peristaltic pump to dispense sanitizing liquid with an IR sensor all connected to an Arduino Nano. A manual alternate prototype without any electronics is also provided which heavily relies on the force of gravity to function.

The files included are as follows:

  • Final report with user manual
  • 1 minute video pitch of product
  • Code used for Arduino
  • 3D STL files used for printing peristaltic pump casing
  • Demo of alternate prototype

As of March 29, 2019 our final product is complete and fully functioning with presentation on Design Day Winter 2019. There have been slight adjustments with some of the electronics and overall design.

Title: handisan B3C
Desc:
An especially handy (and inexpensive) dispenser


Google Drive project files:

https://drive.google.com/open?id=1_sR2fBU4ZWO-KdJ2...


Instructions to create your own:


You will need:

Bottle of Purell to take pump from (https://www.jeancoutu.com/en/shopping/product/hand...)

Container (recommend Snaplock 500mL https://www.canadiantire.ca/en/pdp/snaplock-rectan...)

Heat shrink tubing (ideally 3/8 Inch - 3/16 Inch https://www.homedepot.ca/en/home/p.heat-shrink-tub...)

1/4 in clear cinyl tubing (https://www.homedepot.ca/en/home/p.clear-vinyl-tub...)

Handisan Button Casing (see .stl file)


Optional if desk mounted:

Clamp (recommend F-clamp https://www.canadiantire.ca/en/pdp/mastercraft-f-c...)

Rubber bands to prevent slipping


Assembly:

Print button casing

Burn or cut correct sized hole in top lid of container for pump

Press pump in place and trim lower tube on angle so that it reaches bottom of container

Cut vinyl to correct length and fit to pump using heat shrink wrap

Feed tube through the printed casing and snap top of pump to bottom of casing*


*Note, you will need to trim a small piece off the side of the pump (e.g. using side cutters) to achieve a perfect fit


Voila!

Title: Advanced Laser Cutting
Desc:
This workshop takes you beyond the basic certification class where participants will be shown how to safely use the Laser cutters located in the Makerspace. This Workshop will consist of a tutorial on how to use extensions and the colour mapping functionality.

Some skills that will be reviewed include: box making extension, living hinge extension, and colour mapping settings. It is recommended to already possess laser cutting basic skills.

Title: Laser Cutting Basics
Desc: This workshop is a certification class where participants will be shown how to safely use the Laser cutters located in the Makerspace. The Workshop will consist of a tutorial on how to use the laser cutter, along with safety measures and approved materials that can be cut. Some skills that will be reviewed include: simple vectoring and rastering concepts, as well as more complex image rastering using bitmaps. Individuals who feel comfortable can be tested following the workshop to be fully certified for using the laser cutter for personal or volunteering purposes!

Title: Fusion 360 CAD Introduction
Desc:
Have you ever wanted to learn how to use CAD software? We are offering a workshop that will cover the basics of sketch based modeling using Fusion 360. We will cover how to create sketches and then extrude them. Other topics that will be covered include the sketch dimension tool, fillets, etc. Possessing these skills can help you create more complex and intricate 3D prints and prototypes.


The Makerspace holds no affiliations with Fusion 360 software

Title: Arduino Basics
Desc: This workshop focuses on the basics of Arduino and understanding I/O control. The workshop is used to familiarize participants with the hardware available for the boards and creating software for the microcontroller boards. Participants will work through some of the example codes in order to understand basic coding, preparing you for use with the Arduino platform.

Title: 3D Printing Advanced
Desc: Learn how to cut down on print times and make full use of the variety of printers in the Makerspace; including dual extrusion for the Ulitmaker 3 and Raise 3D! In this workshop, you will learn more advanced skills in Cura to help reduce print times and provide the most optimum orientation for 3D printing. Previous experience using Cura is highly recommended.

Title: 3D Printing
Desc: In this workshop, you will learn the basics on how to design and 3D print objects. You will learn how to use basic 3D design software [TinkerCAD] to create a personalized object then followed by a step by step tutorial on how to 3D print your object on the various printers in the Makerspace. Please bring your laptops to this workshop to follow along with the activity. Internet connection required.

Title: Soldering basics
Desc: Soldering is the process of using a filler material (solder) to join pieces of metal together (wires, PCB) to from stronger connections. In this workshop participants will be shown how to properly operate the soldering iron. Taking into account safety precautions, as well as tips for making soldering easier. You will learn how to splice, solder and de-solder wires as well as gain some practice on surface mount soldering.

Title: 3D Scanning Workshop
Desc: In this workshop, you will learn how to operate the NextEngine 3D scanner located in the Makerspace. You will learn how to setup a piece for optimal scanning, as well as how to configure the software in order to achieve the best results. 3D scanners are very effective in the field of reverse engineering and can open up your design possibilities. Please note that this workshop is a demonstration as the scanner takes a fair amount of time to complete scans, therefore we will only be covering its operation.
