If you have any further questions, please feel free to contact me at jkim308@uOttawa.ca, I'll try my best to help in any way possible

Title: Embroidery and Sewing Machine Tutorial
Desc:
In this workshop you will learn how to set up and use the Makerspace embroidery and sewing machines!

We will also show you how to make designs on the PE design X software. You can embroider either a sample fabric or a piece of clothing you bring in. All are welcome, no experience needed.

This slideshow is being provided to make the use of the machines simpler for user operation. Demonstrating how to re-thread the machine, as well as how to use the design software.

Title: Time for STEAM
Desc:
"Time for STEAM" is an interactive art project prototype showcased at uOttawa's Design Day for the 2018 Makerspace Challenge.

The concept is using recyclable materials from uOttawa's free store, some 3D printing and laser cutting to produce a clock system that keeps the time using a real-time clock. The clock, telephone dial, and cups move while the LEDs change colours as people walk by the leap motion sensor. There are also other elements representing the "A" in STEAM such as the picture frame with LEDs for visual art, the multi colour-lit keyboard for music, and a smartphone with a camera representing the viewers walking by as their pixelated forms as theater/ film art.

This piece was intended to remind viewers that art derives from technology developed over time, but technology has also grown by following the development of art.
tags: ['Other Projects', 'Internet of Things', 'Virtual Reality', 'Arduino Microcontroller', 'Laser Cutter', 'Soldering']

Title: Interactive 2d projector with Xbox kinect
Desc:
Here are the steps to make your own interactive xbox kinect projector controlled by your fingers

Materials:

- An Xbox Kinect.
- A 12v 2A power supply
- A USB cable
- Soldering iron + solder
- Projector

- PC with windows and an hdmi port


How to set up xbox 360 kinect to PC port:


1. solder usb wires to kinect wires following color coding

Red -> red

green -> green

white -> white

put black wires together

2. Solder the brown Kinect wire to the 12v adapter positive, and the 12v adapter negative to the Kinect/USB black


Set up the program to make you kinect and projector interactive:

https://code.google.com/archive/p/ubidisplays/

This site will provide all the instructions to all the drivers for PC compatibility to the kinect. Also, from there you can download the free use program that allows you to use the kinect with your projector without having to program all of this.


Lastly, once you get the program running and learn the basic functionality of it, you can calibrate it and drag any html5 file into the calibrated projector box and you should be able to physically interact with it. Keep in mind that I didn't have much time to fix and program a lot, thus there is a lot of bugs this program and the code I made.


I will provide the code I made in the Project files

Title: Interactive Nature

This artistic and interactive project allows the users to visualize the beauty of the peacock as they approach it.

Title: GNG1103- Water group shed 3
Desc: This is the water system responsible for water collection (via rainwater harvesting) and distribution to shed 3. This projects duration was approximately 4 months. The apparatus consists of eavestroughs to collect water on either side of the angled roof, PEX pipes to guide the water down to the water tank, a water tank with a 4 layer filtration system and a automated pump that distributes water to the sink on the inside of the small home.

Desc: Hydroponics System 2018

Title: BloCarton B6
Desc: BloCarton (aka BloCup) is an eco-friendly pedestrian blocker designed for medians. Our aim was to design a triple-bottom line business plan in response to: (social) the growing population seeking alternative income (panhandlers), (environment) increasing landfill diversion rates and increasing public understanding of compost and recycling programs here, and (economic) low cost to fabricate + prime ad space = maximize profit

Title: GNG1103 - S1 - Water
Desc: The Algonquins of Barriere lake are in need of a more sanitary and reliable source of water for everyday use. Rainwater harvesting is proven to be the most feasible and reliable source of water for the Algonquin community. Through various prototyping and testing we have developed a rainwater harvesting system that incorporates a gutter collection system, natural filtration system, storage facility and an integrated dispersion facility to accommodate for the small nature of the net-zero homes.

Desc: Hydroponics System modeled after a rotating blackboard

Title: GNG1103 - Shed 1 - Automation
Desc:
Design Day's winning team in the Zero Carbon Footprint Shed category - Automation Team A1

Design incorporates LEDs, Raspberry P 3, terminal strips for parallel connection, solenoid push/pull, solenoid water valve, matrix keypad, buzzer, PIR sensors, relay module, ultrasonic sensors, light switches, soldering board, 3D printed light fixtures, and Python coding.

Title: GNG1103C - C6 - Hydroponics with app
Desc: Hydroponic setup with Arduino sensor+Bluetooth to app for measuring water levels.. It holds 32 plants, 80 L of water and uses 2 electrical sockets (1 for the pump, and 1 for the Arduino). Don't forget to use a voltage divider if you are going from Arduino to a regular Bluetooth.

Title: Self-Sustainable Modular Shed
Desc: This self-sustainable shed was built for the residents of Barriere Lake Reserve in Quebec. The project was completed throughout the semester in our class GNG1103B, Engineering Design.

Title: Net Zero Home Water Group B2
Desc: Our goal was to create the water system for a net-zero home for an indigenous community in Northern Quebec. We had to devise a system that could collect, filter, heat, and distribute water to the residents of the shed. The system had to withstand regular use as well as a Canadian winter, while staying within the budget of $100.

Title: Herb Reserve - GNG 1103 C10- Hydroponic

Title: Aquatic Seed Launcher A21
Desc:
This device is a seed launching attachment for the Bowie robot. The water-wheel fits inside the case, to make the dispenser. The dispenser fits inside the Seed Feeder.

The two holes on the Seed Feeder are sized to fit specific fan blowers: Found here.

They need to be wired to the Arduino with relay, along with the DC motor, which needs to be mounted to the knob on the water-wheel.

Finally, connect the IR receiver to the Arduino as shown in the wiring diagram.

Title: Fire Notification Network
Desc:
The Fire Notification Network or FiNN is a system of devices interconnected over WIFI that help to detect and notify hard of hearing individuals in the event of a fire incident. The two types of devices in this system are the Access point and the Client device (Pager for this project).


For more information, please see documentation and files in the zipped folder provided.

This project was created by: Philip Barry, Nduka David, Neha Pawar, Nikita Blumkin

Special thanks to Harjot Chahal .

Title: Steady Utensil
Desc: Persons suffering from neurological disorders often experience an essential tremor. Essential tremor causes uncontrolled muscle contractions, often most severe in the hands. As a result, they often have great difficulty performing tasks that members of the general public would consider quite simple like eating with a fork and spoon. The goal of this project was to produce a utensil holder which could be used by the patient to hold their utensil without causing it to shake.
